WHY SMALL HABITS MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 15 | bei Position 256 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:27:48


==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 16 | bei Position 259-260 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:28:17

Habits are the compound interest of self-improvement.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 16 | bei Position 260-261 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:28:34

The same way that money multiplies through compound interest, the effects of your habits multiply as you repeat them.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 17 | bei Position 267-268 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:29:35

Unfortunately, the slow pace of transformation also makes it easy to let a bad habit slide.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 17 | bei Position 269-270 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:29:41

A single decision is easy to dismiss.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 17 | bei Position 277-280 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:30:48

Similarly, a slight change in your daily habits can guide your life to a very different destination. Making a choice that is 1 percent better or 1 percent worse seems insignificant in the moment, but over the span of moments that make up a lifetime these choices determine the difference between who you are and who you could be. Success is the product of daily habits—not once-in-a-lifetime transformations.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 284-287 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:31:49

Your outcomes are a lagging measure of your habits. Your net worth is a lagging measure of your financial habits. Your weight is a lagging measure of your eating habits. Your knowledge is a lagging measure of your learning habits. Your clutter is a lagging measure of your cleaning habits. You get what you repeat.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 290-291 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:32:26

Time magnifies the margin between success and failure. It will multiply whatever you feed it. Good habits make time your ally. Bad habits make time your enemy.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 291-293 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. Januar 2021 08:32:41

Habits are a double-edged sword.15 Bad habits can cut you down just as easily as good habits can build you up, which is why understanding the details is crucial.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 296-302 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 09:58:01

Positive Compounding Negative Compounding Productivity compounds. Accomplishing one extra task is a small feat on any given day, but it counts for a lot over an entire career.14 The effect of automating an old task or mastering a new skill can be even greater. The more tasks you can handle without thinking, the more your brain is free to focus on other areas.16 Stress compounds. The frustration of a traffic jam. The weight of parenting responsibilities. The worry of making ends meet. The strain of slightly high blood pressure. By themselves, these common causes of stress are manageable. But when they persist for years, little stresses compound into serious health issues.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 303-308 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 09:59:14

Knowledge compounds. Learning one new idea won’t make you a genius, but a commitment to lifelong learning can be transformative. Furthermore, each book you read not only teaches you something new but also opens up different ways of thinking about old ideas.17 As Warren Buffett says, “That’s how knowledge works. It builds up, like compound interest.” Negative thoughts compound. The more you think of yourself as worthless, stupid, or ugly, the more you condition yourself to interpret life that way. You get trapped in a thought loop. The same is true for how you think about others. Once you fall into the habit of seeing people as angry, unjust, or selfish, you see those kind of people everywhere.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 309-313 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 09:59:52

Relationships compound. People reflect your behavior back to you. The more you help others, the more others want to help you. Being a little bit nicer in each interaction can result in a network of broad and strong connections over time. Outrage compounds. Riots, protests, and mass movements are rarely the result of a single event. Instead, a long series of microaggressions and daily aggravations slowly multiply until one event tips the scales and outrage spreads like wildfire.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 20 | bei Position 320-321 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:01:27

Breakthrough moments are often the result of many previous actions, which build up the potential required to unleash a major change.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 20 | bei Position 326-327 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:02:19

It’s a hallmark of any compounding process: the most powerful outcomes are delayed.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 20 | bei Position 327-328 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:02:40

This is one of the core reasons why it is so hard to build habits that last.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 330-331 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:03:17

But in order to make a meaningful difference, habits need to persist long enough to break through this plateau—what I call the Plateau of Latent Potential.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 337-340 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:04:23

the jump today possible. It is the human equivalent of geological pressure. Two tectonic plates can grind against one another for millions of years, the tension slowly building all the while. Then, one day, they rub each other once again, in the same fashion they have for ages, but this time the tension is too great. An earthquake erupts. Change can take years—before it happens all at once.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)

Then, one day, they rub each other once again, in the same fashion they have for ages, but this time the tension is too great. An earthquake erupts. Change can take years—before it happens all at once.

﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 335-337 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:04:46

When you finally break through the Plateau of Latent Potential, people will call it an overnight success. The outside world only sees the most dramatic event rather than all that preceded it. But you know that it’s the work you did long ago—when it seemed that you weren’t making any progress—that makes the jump today possible.

FORGET ABOUT GOALS, FOCUS ON SYSTEMS INSTEAD
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 23 | bei Position 361-363 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:08:21

Prevailing wisdom claims that the best way to achieve what we want in life—getting into better shape, building a successful business, relaxing more and worrying less, spending more time with friends and family—is to set specific, actionable goals.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 23 | bei Position 366-366 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:08:45

What’s the difference between systems and goals?
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 23 | bei Position 367-368 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:08:51

Goals are about the results you want to achieve. Systems are about the processes that lead to those results.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 374-377 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:09:35

Now for the interesting question: If you completely ignored your goals and focused only on your system, would you still succeed? For example, if you were a basketball coach and you ignored your goal to win a championship and focused only on what your team does at practice each day, would you still get results? I think you would.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 381-381 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:10:04

Goals are good for setting a direction, but systems are best for making progress.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 383-383 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:12:16

Problem #1: Winners and losers have the same goals.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 25 | bei Position 386-388 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:12:54

Every Olympian wants to win a gold medal. Every candidate wants to get the job. And if successful and unsuccessful people share the same goals, then the goal cannot be what differentiates the winners from the losers.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 25 | bei Position 391-392 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:13:43

Problem #2: Achieving a goal is only a momentary change.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 25 | bei Position 394-396 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:14:13

You’re left chasing the same outcome because you never changed the system behind it. You treated a symptom without addressing the cause. Achieving a goal only changes your life for the moment.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 25 | bei Position 398-399 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:14:42

In order to improve for good, you need to solve problems at the systems level. Fix the inputs and the outputs will fix themselves.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 399-400 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:14:53

Problem #3: Goals restrict your happiness.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 400-402 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:15:35

The implicit assumption behind any goal is this: “Once I reach my goal, then I’ll be happy.” The problem with a goals-first mentality is that you’re continually putting happiness off until the next milestone.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 404-406 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:16:02

Furthermore, goals create an “either-or” conflict: either you achieve your goal and are successful or you fail and you are a disappointment. You mentally box yourself into a narrow version of happiness. This is misguided.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 407-410 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:16:41

A systems-first mentality provides the antidote. When you fall in love with the process rather than the product, you don’t have to wait to give yourself permission to be happy. You can be satisfied anytime your system is running. And a system can be successful in many different forms, not just the one you first envision.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 410-411 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:16:55

Problem #4: Goals are at odds with long-term progress.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 412-414 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:17:28

When all of your hard work is focused on a particular goal, what is left to push you forward after you achieve it? This is why many people find themselves reverting to their old habits after accomplishing a goal.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 414-417 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:17:58

The purpose of setting goals is to win the game. The purpose of building systems is to continue playing the game. True long-term thinking is goal-less thinking. It’s not about any single accomplishment. It is about the cycle of endless refinement and continuous improvement. Ultimately, it is your commitment to the process that will determine your progress.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 417-418 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:18:28

A SYSTEM OF ATOMIC HABITS
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 419-420 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:18:47

Bad habits repeat themselves again and again not because you don’t want to change, but because you have the wrong system for change.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 420-421 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:19:00

You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 422-425 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:20:13

By now, you’ve probably realized that an atomic habit refers to a tiny change, a marginal gain, a 1 percent improvement. But atomic habits are not just any old habits, however small. They are little habits that are part of a larger system. Just as atoms are the building blocks of molecules, atomic habits are the building blocks of remarkable results.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 427-429 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:20:45

This is the meaning of the phrase atomic habits—a regular practice or routine that is not only small and easy to do, but also the source of incredible power; a component of the system of compound growth.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 439-440 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 5. Januar 2021 10:21:34

You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.

﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)

WHY IS IT so easy to repeat bad habits and so hard to form good ones?
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 453-455 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:17:39

FIGURE 3: There are three layers of behavior change: a change in your outcomes, a change in your processes, or a change in your identity.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 455-457 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:18:28

The first layer is changing your outcomes. This level is concerned with changing your results: losing weight, publishing a book, winning a championship. Most of the goals you set are associated with this level of change.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 457-459 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:18:47

The second layer is changing your process. This level is concerned with changing your habits and systems: implementing a new routine at the gym, decluttering your desk for better workflow, developing a meditation practice. Most of the habits you build are associated with this level.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 459-461 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:19:01

The third and deepest layer is changing your identity. This level is concerned with changing your beliefs: your worldview, your self-image, your judgments about yourself and others. Most of the beliefs, assumptions, and biases you hold are associated with this level.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 461-462 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:19:14

Outcomes are about what you get. Processes are about what you do. Identity is about what you believe.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 464-466 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:19:55

The problem is the direction of change. Many people begin the process of changing their habits by focusing on what they want to achieve. This leads us to outcome-based habits. The alternative is to build identity-based habits. With this approach, we start by focusing on who we wish to become.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 467 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:20:10


==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 478-478 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:21:06

Behind every system of actions is a system of beliefs.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 482-484 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:21:43

There are a set of beliefs and assumptions that shape the system, an identity behind the habits. Behavior that is incongruent with the self will not last.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 482-483 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:21:53

A similar pattern exists whether we are discussing individuals, organizations, or societies. There are a set of beliefs and assumptions that shape the system, an identity behind the habits.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 483-484 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:22:08

The ultimate form of intrinsic motivation is when a habit becomes part of your identity.
==========

The ultimate form of intrinsic motivation is when a habit becomes part of your identity. It’s one thing to say I’m the type of person who wants this. It’s something very different to say I’m the type of person who is this.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 497-499 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:24:05

The ultimate form of intrinsic motivation is when a habit becomes part of your identity. It’s one thing to say I’m the type of person who wants this. It’s something very different to say I’m the type of person who is this.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 503-504 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:24:54

True behavior change is identity change. You might start a habit because of motivation, but the only reason you’ll stick with one is that it becomes part of your identity.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 505-506 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:25:12

Improvements are only temporary until they become part of who you are.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 512-513 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:26:19

Research has shown that once a person believes in a particular aspect of their identity, they are more likely to act in alignment with that belief.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 517-518 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:26:40

Like all aspects of habit formation, this, too, is a double-edged sword.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 519-520 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:27:08

Once you have adopted an identity, it can be easy to let your allegiance to it impact your ability to change.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 532-533 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:27:52

It can feel comfortable to believe what your culture believes (group identity) or to do what upholds your self-image (personal identity), even if it’s wrong.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 531-533 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:27:59

The more deeply a thought or action is tied to your identity, the more difficult it is to change it. It can feel comfortable to believe what your culture believes (group identity) or to do what upholds your self-image (personal identity), even if it’s wrong.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 533-534 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:28:10

The biggest barrier to positive change at any level—individual, team, society—is identity conflict.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)

THE TWO-STEP PROCESS TO CHANGING YOUR IDENTITY
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 36 | bei Position 542-544 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:29:46

Your identity emerges out of your habits. You are not born with preset beliefs. Every belief, including those about yourself, is learned and conditioned through experience.fn2
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 37 | bei Position 550-550 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:31:04

Whatever your identity is right now, you only believe it because you have proof of it.

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 37 | bei Position 552-553 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:31:09

==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 37 | bei Position 556-557 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 6. Januar 2021 08:32:10

Of course, your habits are not the only actions that influence your identity, but by virtue of their frequency they are usually the most important ones.

﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)

﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)

The process of building a habit can be divided into four simple steps: cue, craving, response, and reward.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 690-691 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:55:25

THE SCIENCE OF HOW HABITS WORK
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 694 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:55:39


==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 697-698 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:56:39

First, there is the cue. The cue triggers your brain to initiate a behavior. It is a bit of information that predicts a reward.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 702-703 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:56:55

Because the cue is the first indication that we’re close to a reward, it naturally leads to a craving.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 703-704 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:57:10

Cravings are the second step, and they are the motivational force behind every habit. Without some level of motivation or desire—without craving a change—we have no reason to act.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 706-707 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:57:41

Every craving is linked to a desire to change your internal state.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 704-705 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:57:49

What you crave is not the habit itself but the change in state it delivers.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 710-711 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:58:22

Cues are meaningless until they are interpreted. The thoughts, feelings, and emotions of the observer are what transform a cue into a craving.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 711-713 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:58:47

The third step is the response. The response is the actual habit you perform, which can take the form of a thought or an action. Whether a response occurs depends on how motivated you are and how much friction is associated with the behavior.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 713-713 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:59:17

physical or mental effort
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 714-714 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:59:24

ability.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 716-718 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 09:59:54

Finally, the response delivers a reward. Rewards are the end goal of every habit. The cue is about noticing the reward. The craving is about wanting the reward. The response is about obtaining the reward. We chase rewards because they serve two purposes: (1) they satisfy us and (2) they teach us. The first purpose of rewards is to satisfy your craving.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 716-718 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:00:12

Finally, the response delivers a reward. Rewards are the end goal of every habit. The cue is about noticing the reward. The craving is about wanting the reward. The response is about obtaining the reward. We chase rewards because they serve two purposes: (1) they satisfy us and (2) they teach us.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 718-719 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:00:51

Yes, rewards provide benefits on their own.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 720-720 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:00:57

But the more immediate benefit is that rewards satisfy your craving
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 724-725 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:01:44

Rewards close the feedback loop and complete the habit cycle.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 721-722 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:01:54

Second, rewards teach us which actions are worth remembering in the future.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 725-728 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:02:18

a behavior is insufficient in any of the four stages, it will not become a habit. Eliminate the cue and your habit will never start. Reduce the craving and you won’t experience enough motivation to act. Make the behavior difficult and you won’t be able to do it. And if the reward fails to satisfy your desire, then you’ll have no reason to do it again in the future.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 725-725 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:02:25

If
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 50 | bei Position 730 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:02:44


==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 50 | bei Position 735-738 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:03:25

In summary, the cue triggers a craving, which motivates a response, which provides a reward, which satisfies the craving and, ultimately, becomes associated with the cue. Together, these four steps form a neurological feedback loop—cue, craving, response, reward; cue, craving, response, reward—that ultimately allows you to create automatic habits. This cycle is known as the habit loop.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 50 | bei Position 742-744 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:04:06

We can split these four steps into two phases: the problem phase and the solution phase. The problem phase includes the cue and the craving, and it is when you realize that something needs to change. The solution phase includes the response and the reward, and it is when you take action and achieve the change you desire.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 50 | bei Position 745-745 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:04:24

All behavior is driven by the desire to solve a problem.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 50 | bei Position 754-755 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:07:11

THE FOUR LAWS OF BEHAVIOR CHANGE
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 53 | bei Position 757-759 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:07:51

I refer to this framework as the Four Laws of Behavior Change, and it provides a simple set of rules for creating good habits and breaking bad ones.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 54 | bei Position 774-777 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 7. Januar 2021 10:09:29

Whenever you want to change your behavior, you can simply ask yourself: How can I make it obvious? How can I make it attractive? How can I make it easy? How can I make it satisfying?
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 60 | bei Position 813-820 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:53:47

The human brain is a prediction machine.5 It is continuously taking in your surroundings and analyzing the information it comes across. Whenever you experience something repeatedly—like a paramedic seeing the face of a heart attack patient or a military analyst seeing a missile on a radar screen—your brain begins noticing what is important, sorting through the details and highlighting the relevant cues, and cataloging that information for future use. With enough practice, you can pick up on the cues that predict certain outcomes without consciously thinking about it. Automatically, your brain encodes the lessons learned through experience. We can’t always explain what it is we are learning, but learning is happening all along the way, and your ability to notice the relevant cues in a given situation is the foundation for every habit you have.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 61 | bei Position 826-828 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:54:47

This is one of the most surprising insights about our habits: you don’t need to be aware of the cue for a habit to begin. You can notice an opportunity and take action without dedicating conscious attention to it. This is what makes habits useful.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 61 | bei Position 831-832 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:55:54

And the more you repeat these patterns, the less likely you become to question what you’re doing and why you’re doing it.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 61 | bei Position 828-828 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:56:02

It’s also what makes them dangerous.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 61 | bei Position 829-829 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:56:15

You fall into old patterns before you realize what’s happening.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 62 | bei Position 840-841 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:57:21

Over time, the cues that spark our habits become so common that they are essentially invisible:
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 62 | bei Position 841-843 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:57:34

Our responses to these cues are so deeply encoded that it may feel like the urge to act comes from nowhere. For this reason, we must begin the process of behavior change with awareness.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 62 | bei Position 845-846 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:58:02

As the psychologist Carl Jung said, “Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.”
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 62 | bei Position 847-847 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:58:17

THE HABITS SCORECARD
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 63 | bei Position 855-857 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:59:30

This process, known as Pointing-and-Calling, is a safety system designed to reduce mistakes. It seems silly, but it works incredibly well. Pointing-and-Calling reduces errors by up to 85 percent and cuts accidents by 30 percent.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 63 | bei Position 859-860 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 08:59:59

Pointing-and-Calling is so effective because it raises the level of awareness from a nonconscious habit to a more conscious level.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 64 | bei Position 863-865 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:00:41

The more automatic a behavior becomes, the less likely we are to consciously think about it. And when we’ve done something a thousand times before, we begin to overlook things.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 64 | bei Position 866-867 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:01:02

Many of our failures in performance are largely attributable to a lack of self-awareness.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 64 | bei Position 867-868 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:01:18

One of our greatest challenges in changing habits is maintaining awareness of what we are actually doing. This helps explain why the consequences of bad habits can sneak up on us. We need a “point-and-call” system for our personal lives.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 64 | bei Position 868-870 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:01:28

That’s the origin of the Habits Scorecard, which is a simple exercise you can use to become more aware of your behavior. To create your own, make a list of your daily habits.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 64 | bei Position 881-884 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:02:10

Once you have a full list, look at each behavior, and ask yourself, “Is this a good habit, a bad habit, or a neutral habit?” If it is a good habit, write “+” next to it. If it is a bad habit, write “–”. If it is a neutral habit, write “=”.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 65 | bei Position 895-896 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:02:50

The marks you give to a particular habit will depend on your situation and your goals.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 65 | bei Position 899-901 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:03:27

The labels “good habit” and “bad habit” are slightly inaccurate. There are no good habits or bad habits. There are only effective habits. That is, effective at solving problems. All habits serve you in some way—even the bad ones—which is why you repeat them.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 65 | bei Position 901-901 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:03:48

For this exercise, categorize your habits by how they will benefit you in the long run.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 65 | bei Position 904-905 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:04:06

“Does this behavior help me become the type of person I wish to be? Does this habit cast a vote for or against my desired identity?”
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 911-912 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:04:55

The first step to changing bad habits is to be on the lookout for them.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 912-913 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:05:30

try Pointing-and-Calling in your own life. Say out loud the action that you are thinking of taking and what the outcome will be.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 915-916 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:05:45

Hearing your bad habits spoken aloud makes the consequences seem more real. It adds weight to the action rather than letting yourself mindlessly slip into an old routine.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 918-920 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:06:18

The process of behavior change always starts with awareness. Strategies like Pointing-and-Calling and the Habits Scorecard are focused on getting you to recognize your habits and acknowledge the cues that trigger them, which makes it possible to respond in a way that benefits you.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 943-944 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:09:15

implementation intention, which is a plan you make beforehand about when and where to act. That is, how you intend to implement a particular habit.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 945-945 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:09:37

the two most common cues are time and location
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 944-944 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:09:44

The cues that can trigger a habit come in a wide range of forms
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 946-946 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:09:47

Implementation intentions leverage both of these cues.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 946-948 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:10:01

Broadly speaking, the format for creating an implementation intention is: “When situation X arises, I will perform response Y.”
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 957-958 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:11:32

The punch line is clear: people who make a specific plan for when and where they will perform a new habit are more likely to follow through.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 71 | bei Position 961-963 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:11:47

An implementation intention sweeps away foggy notions like “I want to work out more” or “I want to be more productive” or “I should vote” and transforms them into a concrete plan of action.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 71 | bei Position 963-963 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:12:01

Many people think they lack motivation when what they really lack is clarity
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 71 | bei Position 967-969 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:12:46

The simple way to apply this strategy to your habits is to fill out this sentence: I will [BEHAVIOR] at [TIME] in [LOCATION].
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 71 | bei Position 973-974 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:14:04

I will make my partner a cup of tea at 8 a.m. in the kitchen. If
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 71 | bei Position 974-977 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:14:17

If you aren’t sure when to start your habit, try the first day of the week, month, or year. People are more likely to take action at those times because hope is usually higher.8 If we have hope, we have a reason to take action. A fresh start feels motivating.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 72 | bei Position 980-982 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:15:17

Give your habits a time and a space to live in the world. The goal is to make the time and location so obvious that, with enough repetition, you get an urge to do the right thing at the right time, even if you can’t say why.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 72 | bei Position 986-987 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 8. Januar 2021 09:16:02

HABIT STACKING: A SIMPLE PLAN TO OVERHAUL YOUR HABITS
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 73 | bei Position 1001-1003 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:35:06

The Diderot Effect states that obtaining a new possession often creates a spiral of consumption that leads to additional purchases.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 73 | bei Position 1008-1008 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:35:42

No behavior happens in isolation. Each action becomes a cue that triggers the next behavior.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 74 | bei Position 1009-1011 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:35:56

When it comes to building new habits, you can use the connectedness of behavior to your advantage. One of the best ways to build a new habit is to identify a current habit you already do each day and then stack your new behavior on top. This is called habit stacking.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 74 | bei Position 1015-1016 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:36:34

The habit stacking formula is: “After [CURRENT HABIT], I will [NEW HABIT].”
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 77 | bei Position 1054-1056 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:39:50

No matter how you use this strategy, the secret to creating a successful habit stack is selecting the right cue to kick things off. Unlike an implementation intention, which specifically states the time and location for a given behavior, habit stacking implicitly has the time and location built into it.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 77 | bei Position 1058-1059 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:40:17

Consider when you are most likely to be successful. Don’t ask yourself to do a habit when you’re likely to be occupied with something else.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 77 | bei Position 1059-1060 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:40:52

Your cue should also have the same frequency as your desired habit.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 77 | bei Position 1061-1062 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:41:00

One way to find the right trigger for your habit stack is by brainstorming a list of your current habits.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 78 | bei Position 1083-1084 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:41:54

Habit stacking works best when the cue is highly specific and immediately actionable.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 78 | bei Position 1089-1091 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:42:47

Be specific and clear: After I close the door. After I brush my teeth. After I sit down at the table. The specificity is important. The more tightly bound your new habit is to a specific cue, the better the odds are that you will notice when the time comes to act.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 82 | bei Position 1122-1124 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:45:55

Your habits change depending on the room you are in and the cues in front of you. Environment is the invisible hand that shapes human behavior. Despite our unique personalities, certain behaviors tend to arise again and again under certain environmental conditions.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 83 | bei Position 1125-1126 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:46:16

In this way, the most common form of change is not internal, but external: we are changed by the world around us. Every habit is context dependent.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 83 | bei Position 1139-1140 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:48:08

The truth, however, is that many of the actions we take each day are shaped not by purposeful drive and choice but by the most obvious option.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 84 | bei Position 1150-1151 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:49:10

Given that we are more dependent on vision than on any other sense, it should come as no surprise that visual cues are the greatest catalyst of our behavior.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 84 | bei Position 1151-1153 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:49:25

For this reason, a small change in what you see can lead to a big shift in what you do. As a result, you can imagine how important it is to live and work in environments that are filled with productive cues and devoid of unproductive ones.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 85 | bei Position 1155-1156 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:49:36

HOW TO DESIGN YOUR ENVIRONMENT FOR SUCCESS
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 85 | bei Position 1162-1162 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 9. Januar 2021 10:51:14

Every habit is initiated by a cue, and we are more likely to notice cues that stand out.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)

If you want to make a habit a big part of your life, make the cue a big part of your environment. The most persistent behaviors usually have multiple cues.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)

THE CONTEXT IS THE CUE
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 87 | bei Position 1192-1194 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:27:30

The cues that trigger a habit can start out very specific, but over time your habits become associated not with a single trigger but with the entire context surrounding the behavior.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 87 | bei Position 1198-1200 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:28:05

Our behavior is not defined by the objects in the environment but by our relationship to them. In fact, this is a useful way to think about the influence of the environment on your behavior. Stop thinking about your environment as filled with objects. Start thinking about it as filled with relationships. Think
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 88 | bei Position 1211-1212 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:29:16

It is easier to associate a new habit with a new context than to build a new habit in the face of competing cues.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 89 | bei Position 1220-1222 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:30:13

When you can’t manage to get to an entirely new environment, redefine or rearrange your current one. Create a separate space for work, study, exercise, entertainment, and cooking. The mantra I find useful is “One space, one use.”
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 89 | bei Position 1228-1229 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:31:01

Whenever possible, avoid mixing the context of one habit with another. When you start mixing contexts, you’ll start mixing habits—and the easier ones will usually win out.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 90 | bei Position 1234-1235 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:31:30

If your space is limited, divide your room into activity zones: a chair for reading, a desk for writing, a table for eating. You can do the same with your digital spaces.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 90 | bei Position 1239-1240 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:32:17

If you want behaviors that are stable and predictable, you need an environment that is stable and predictable.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 92 | bei Position 1273-1277 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:36:21

The idea that a little bit of discipline would solve all our problems is deeply embedded in our culture. Recent research, however, shows something different. When scientists analyze people who appear to have tremendous self-control, it turns out those individuals aren’t all that different from those who are struggling. Instead, “disciplined” people are better at structuring their lives in a way that does not require heroic willpower and self-control. In other words, they spend less time in tempting situations.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1286-1291 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:37:57

Once a habit has been encoded, the urge to act follows whenever the environmental cues reappear. This is one reason behavior change techniques can backfire. Shaming obese people with weight-loss presentations can make them feel stressed, and as a result many people return to their favorite coping strategy: overeating.9 Showing pictures of blackened lungs to smokers leads to higher levels of anxiety, which drives many people to reach for a cigarette.10 If you’re not careful about cues, you can cause the very behavior you want to stop.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1291-1295 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:38:28

Bad habits are autocatalytic: the process feeds itself. They foster the feelings they try to numb. You feel bad, so you eat junk food. Because you eat junk food, you feel bad. Watching television makes you feel sluggish, so you watch more television because you don’t have the energy to do anything else. Worrying about your health makes you feel anxious, which causes you to smoke to ease your anxiety, which makes your health even worse and soon you’re feeling more anxious. It’s a downward spiral, a runaway train of bad habits.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1295-1296 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:38:42

Researchers refer to this phenomenon as “cue-induced wanting”: an external trigger causes a compulsive craving to repeat a bad habit.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1304-1305 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:39:44

To put it bluntly, I have never seen someone consistently stick to positive habits in a negative environment.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1301-1301 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:39:54

You can break a habit, but you’re unlikely to forget it.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1302-1303 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:40:08

that means that simply resisting temptation is an ineffective strategy.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1305-1307 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:40:22

A more reliable approach is to cut bad habits off at the source. One of the most practical ways to eliminate a bad habit is to reduce exposure to the cue that causes it.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1315-1315 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:40:59

Rather than make it obvious, you can make it invisible.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1315-1316 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:41:11

I’m often surprised by how effective simple changes like these can be. Remove a single cue and the entire habit often fades away.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 1371-1373 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:45:28

A supernormal stimulus is a heightened version of reality—like a beak with three red dots or an egg the size of a volleyball—and it elicits a stronger response than usual.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 104 | bei Position 1396-1396 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:47:47

2nd Law of Behavior Change: Make it attractive.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 104 | bei Position 1396-1397 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:47:55

The more attractive an opportunity is, the more likely it is to become habit-forming.

﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 104 | bei Position 1407-1408 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:49:26

﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 104 | bei Position 1408-1411 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 10. Januar 2021 10:49:56

While it is not possible to transform every habit into a supernormal stimulus, we can make any habit more enticing. To do this, we must start by understanding what a craving is and how it works. We begin by examining a biological signature that all habits share—the dopamine spike.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1411-1412 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:32:56

THE DOPAMINE-DRIVEN FEEDBACK LOOP
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1428-1431 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:34:57

Habits are a dopamine-driven feedback loop.14 Every behavior that is highly habit-forming—taking drugs, eating junk food, playing video games, browsing social media—is associated with higher levels of dopamine. The same can be said for our most basic habitual behaviors like eating food, drinking water, having sex, and interacting socially.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1433-1435 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:35:23

When it comes to habits, the key takeaway is this: dopamine is released not only when you experience pleasure, but also when you anticipate it.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1436-1438 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:35:50

Whenever you predict that an opportunity will be rewarding, your levels of dopamine spike in anticipation. And whenever dopamine rises, so does your motivation to act.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1438-1439 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:35:58

It is the anticipation of a reward—not the fulfillment of it—that gets us to take action.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1439-1441 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:36:36

Interestingly, the reward system that is activated in the brain when you receive a reward is the same system that is activated when you anticipate a reward.18 This is one reason the anticipation of an experience can often feel better than the attainment of it.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1444 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:37:00


==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 108 | bei Position 1465-1466 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:37:54

Desire is the engine that drives behavior. Every action is taken because of the anticipation that precedes it. It is the craving that leads to the response.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 108 | bei Position 1467-1469 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:38:11

We need to make our habits attractive because it is the expectation of a rewarding experience that motivates us to act in the first place. This is where a strategy known as temptation bundling comes into play.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 108 | bei Position 1469-1470 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:38:19

HOW TO USE TEMPTATION BUNDLING TO MAKE YOUR HABITS MORE ATTRACTIVE
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 109 | bei Position 1476-1476 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:39:22

Temptation bundling works by linking an action you want to do with an action you need to do.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 109 | bei Position 1489-1490 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:41:09

You’re more likely to find a behavior attractive if you get to do one of your favorite things at the same time.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 110 | bei Position 1493-1496 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:42:02

Temptation bundling is one way to apply a psychology theory known as Premack’s Principle. Named after the work of professor David Premack, the principle states that “more probable behaviors will reinforce less probable behaviors.”23 In other words, even if you don’t really want to process overdue work emails, you’ll become conditioned to do it if it means you get to do something you really want to do along the way.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 110 | bei Position 1498-1499 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:42:12

The habit stacking + temptation bundling formula is:
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 110 | bei Position 1496-1497 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:42:20

You can even combine temptation bundling with the habit stacking strategy
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 110 | bei Position 1499-1500 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:42:31

After [CURRENT HABIT], I will [HABIT I NEED]. After [HABIT I NEED], I will [HABIT I WANT].
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 111 | bei Position 1510-1512 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:43:44

Temptation bundling is one way to create a heightened version of any habit by connecting it with something you already want. Engineering a truly irresistible habit is a hard task, but this simple strategy can be employed to make nearly any habit more attractive than it would be otherwise.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1545-1547 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:46:52

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 116 | bei Position 1564-1566 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:49:15

﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 116 | bei Position 1575-1576 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:51:14

As a general rule, the closer we are to someone, the more likely we are to imitate some of their habits.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 117 | bei Position 1585-1586 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:52:14

One of the most effective things you can do to build better habits is to join a culture where your desired behavior is the normal behavior.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 117 | bei Position 1589-1590 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:52:36

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 117 | bei Position 1590-1591 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:52:56

==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1643-1643 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. Januar 2021 07:59:17

We are drawn to behaviors that earn us respect, approval, admiration, and status.

WHERE CRAVINGS COME FROM
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 127 | bei Position 1696-1696 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 07:56:23

Every behavior has a surface level craving and a deeper, underlying motive.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 127 | bei Position 1700-1708 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 07:56:53

Some of our underlying motives include:fn1 ■ Conserve energy ■ Obtain food and water ■ Find love and reproduce ■ Connect and bond with others ■ Win social acceptance and approval ■ Reduce uncertainty ■ Achieve status and prestige A craving is just a specific manifestation of a deeper underlying motive.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 128 | bei Position 1717-1720 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 07:57:57

Your habits are modern-day solutions to ancient desires. New versions of old vices. The underlying motives behind human behavior remain the same. The specific habits we perform differ based on the period of history. Here’s the powerful part: there are many different ways to address the same underlying motive.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 128 | bei Position 1729-1730 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 07:59:36

You see a cue, categorize it based on past experience, and determine the appropriate response. This all happens in an instant, but it plays a crucial role in your habits because every action is preceded by a prediction.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 129 | bei Position 1736-1737 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:01:02

These predictions lead to feelings, which is how we typically describe a craving—a feeling, a desire, an urge. Feelings and emotions transform the cues we perceive and the predictions we make into a signal that we can apply.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 129 | bei Position 1741-1742 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:02:01

A craving is the sense that something is missing. It is the desire to change your internal state.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 129 | bei Position 1744-1744 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:02:28

Desire is the difference between where you are now and where you want to be in the future.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 130 | bei Position 1751-1753 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:04:02

the specific cravings you feel and habits you perform are really an attempt to address your fundamental underlying motives. Whenever a habit successfully addresses a motive, you develop a craving to do it again. In time, you learn to predict that
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 130 | bei Position 1755-1756 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:04:14

HOW TO REPROGRAM YOUR BRAIN TO ENJOY HARD HABITS
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 130 | bei Position 1756-1757 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:04:35

You can make hard habits more attractive if you can learn to associate them with a positive experience.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1767-1769 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:06:07

Reframing your habits to highlight their benefits rather than their drawbacks is a fast and lightweight way to reprogram your mind and make a habit seem more attractive.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 132 | bei Position 1783-1784 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:08:06

If you want to take it a step further, you can create a motivation ritual. You simply practice associating your habits with something you enjoy, then you can use that cue whenever you need a bit of motivation.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 133 | bei Position 1794-1799 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:10:24

You can adapt this strategy for nearly any purpose. Say you want to feel happier in general. Find something that makes you truly happy—like petting your dog or taking a bubble bath—and then create a short routine that you perform every time before you do the thing you love. Maybe you take three deep breaths and smile. Three deep breaths. Smile. Pet the dog. Repeat. Eventually, you’ll begin to associate this breathe-and-smile routine with being in a good mood. It becomes a cue that means feeling happy. Once established, you can break it out anytime you need to change your emotional state.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 133 | bei Position 1801-1802 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. Januar 2021 08:11:04

The key to finding and fixing the causes of your bad habits is to reframe the associations you have about them. It’s not easy, but if you can reprogram your predictions, you can transform a hard habit into an attractive one.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 142 | bei Position 1856-1861 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:48:50

I refer to this as the difference between being in motion and taking action. The two ideas sound similar, but they’re not the same. When you’re in motion, you’re planning and strategizing and learning. Those are all good things, but they don’t produce a result. Action, on the other hand, is the type of behavior that will deliver an outcome. If I outline twenty ideas for articles I want to write, that’s motion. If I actually sit down and write an article, that’s action. If I search for a better diet plan and read a few books on the topic, that’s motion. If I actually eat a healthy meal, that’s action.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 142 | bei Position 1866-1867 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:49:35

And that’s the biggest reason why you slip into motion rather than taking action: you want to delay failure.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 143 | bei Position 1871-1871 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:50:20

When preparation becomes a form of procrastination, you need to change something.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 143 | bei Position 1872-1873 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:50:38

If you want to master a habit, the key is to start with repetition, not perfection. You don’t need to map out every feature of a new habit. You just need to practice it.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 143 | bei Position 1874-1875 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:50:46

HOW LONG DOES IT ACTUALLY TAKE TO FORM A NEW HABIT?
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 143 | bei Position 1875-1876 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:51:12

Habit formation is the process by which a behavior becomes progressively more automatic through repetition.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 144 | bei Position 1899-1901 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:53:17

All habits follow a similar trajectory from effortful practice to automatic behavior, a process known as automaticity. Automaticity is the ability to perform a behavior without thinking about each step, which occurs when the nonconscious mind takes over.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 145 | bei Position 1903 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:53:31


==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 145 | bei Position 1910-1912 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:53:58

The shape of these charts, which scientists call learning curves, reveals an important truth about behavior change: habits form based on frequency, not time.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 145 | bei Position 1913 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:54:15


==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 146 | bei Position 1919-1921 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:55:31

There is nothing magical about time passing with regard to habit formation. It doesn’t matter if it’s been twenty-one days or thirty days or three hundred days. What matters is the rate at which you perform the behavior. You could do something twice in thirty days, or two hundred times. It’s the frequency that makes the difference.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 151 | bei Position 1963-1966 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:59:21

Energy is precious, and the brain is wired to conserve it whenever possible. It is human nature to follow the Law of Least Effort, which states that when deciding between two similar options, people will naturally gravitate toward the option that requires the least amount of work.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 151 | bei Position 1967-1969 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 07:59:37

Out of all the possible actions we could take, the one that is realized is the one that delivers the most value for the least effort. We are motivated to do what is easy.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 152 | bei Position 1975-1977 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:00:38

In a sense, every habit is just an obstacle to getting what you really want. Dieting is an obstacle to getting fit. Meditation is an obstacle to feeling calm. Journaling is an obstacle to thinking clearly. You don’t actually want the habit itself. What you really want is the outcome the habit delivers.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 152 | bei Position 1977-1979 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:00:55

The greater the obstacle—that is, the more difficult the habit—the more friction there is between you and your desired end state. This is why it is crucial to make your habits so easy that you’ll do them even when you don’t feel like it.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 1985-1986 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:01:49

The idea behind make it easy is not to only do easy things. The idea is to make it as easy as possible in the moment to do things that payoff in the long run.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 1986-1987 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:01:55

HOW TO ACHIEVE MORE WITH LESS EFFORT
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 1993-1994 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:02:37

One of the most effective ways to reduce the friction associated with your habits is to practice environment design. In Chapter 6, we discussed environment design as a method for making
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 1993-1994 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:02:43

One of the most effective ways to reduce the friction associated with your habits is to practice environment design.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 1995-1996 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:03:33

For example, when deciding where to practice a new habit, it is best to choose a place that is already along the path of your daily routine.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 1999-1999 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:03:39

Perhaps even more effective is reducing the friction within your home or office.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 154 | bei Position 2008-2009 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:05:01

I like to refer to this strategy as addition by subtraction.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 154 | bei Position 2011-2012 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:05:24

when we remove the points of friction that sap our time and energy, we can achieve more with less effort.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 155 | bei Position 2028-2030 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:07:20

The central idea is to create an environment where doing the right thing is as easy as possible. Much of the battle of building better habits comes down to finding ways to reduce the friction associated with our good habits and increase the friction associated with our bad ones.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 156 | bei Position 2030-2031 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:07:36

PRIME THE ENVIRONMENT FOR FUTURE USE
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 156 | bei Position 2040-2041 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:08:50

Whenever you organize a space for its intended purpose, you are priming it to make the next action easy.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 157 | bei Position 2053-2054 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:10:05

You can also invert this principle and prime the environment to make bad behaviors difficult.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits (Clear, James)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 157 | bei Position 2058-2059 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Januar 2021 08:10:48

In the early 1990s, K. Anders Ericsson, a professor at Florida State University, pulled together these strands into a single coherent answer, consistent with the growing research literature, that he gave a punchy name: deliberate practice.
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 409-409 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:24:22

To learn requires intense concentration.
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 414-417 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:24:42

Ericsson opens his seminal paper on the topic with a powerful claim: “We deny that these differences [between expert performers and normal adults] are immutable … Instead, we argue that the differences between expert performers and normal adults reflect a life-long period of deliberate effort to improve performance in a specific domain.”
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 424-425 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:24:57

This brings us to the question of what deliberate practice actually requires. Its core components are usually identified as follows: (1) your attention is focused tightly on a specific skill
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 424-428 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:26:15

This brings us to the question of what deliberate practice actually requires. Its core components are usually identified as follows: (1) your attention is focused tightly on a specific skill you’re trying to improve or an idea you’re trying to master; (2) you receive feedback so you can correct your approach to keep your attention exactly where it’s most productive. The first component is of particular importance to our discussion, as it emphasizes that deliberate practice cannot exist alongside distraction, and that it instead requires uninterrupted concentration.
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 36 | bei Position 434-437 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:27:19

To understand the role of myelin in improvement, keep in mind that skills, be they intellectual or physical, eventually reduce down to brain circuits. This new science of performance argues that you get better at a skill as you develop more myelin around the relevant neurons, allowing the corresponding circuit to fire more effortlessly and effectively. To be great at something is to be well myelinated.
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 37 | bei Position 446-447 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:28:42

To learn hard things quickly, you must focus intensely without distraction. To learn, in other words, is an act of deep work.
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 37 | bei Position 449-450 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:28:53

Deep Work Helps You Produce
at an Elite Level
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 39 | bei Position 467-468 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:31:09

Though Grant’s productivity depends on many factors, there’s one idea in particular that seems central to his method: the batching of hard but important intellectual work into long, uninterrupted stretches.
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 40 | bei Position 482-485 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 26. Januar 2021 10:33:30

High-Quality Work Produced =
(Time Spent) x (Intensity of Focus) If you believe this formula, then Grant’s habits make sense: By maximizing his intensity when he works, he maximizes the results he produces per unit of time spent working.
==========
Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World (Newport, Cal)

High-Quality Work Produced =
(Time Spent) x (Intensity of Focus)
==========
