- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 9 | bei Position 176-177 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 29. November 2021 23:29:22

The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 10 | bei Position 180-181 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 29. November 2021 23:29:45

The paths to both happiness and success are one and the same.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 10 | bei Position 181-184 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 29. November 2021 23:30:12

You don’t need to wait until you can find more time; you have all the time you need. You don’t need to wait until you can find more money; money never drives success. (Though if you so choose, money can be the result of success.) And you absolutely do not need more motivation. You don’t need to wait to find your passion; if you follow this book’s program, your passions—plural intended, as you’ll soon see—will find you.
==========

CHAPTER 1 Motivation Is Not the Spark
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 12 | bei Position 200-202 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 1. Dezember 2021 23:26:23

Fire-walking is like listening to a motivational speech: You go home inspired and excited and all jazzed up . . . but you wake up the next day the same person you were the day before, because you haven’t truly accomplished anything.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 12 | bei Position 202-205 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 1. Dezember 2021 23:26:57

Most people are confused about the source of motivation. They think motivation is the spark that automatically produces lasting eagerness to do hard work; the greater the motivation, the more effort you’re willing to put in. Actually, motivation is a result. Motivation is the pride you take in work you have already done—which fuels your willingness to do even more.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 12 | bei Position 208-208 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 1. Dezember 2021 23:27:30

The same is true for confidence, confidence being closely linked to motivation.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 13 | bei Position 212-213 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 1. Dezember 2021 23:28:00

Most definitions of “motivation” involve some phrase like “the force or influence that causes someone to do something.”
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 13 | bei Position 214-216 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 1. Dezember 2021 23:28:14

If we aren’t motivated, we can’t do. Bullshit. Real motivation comes after you start.
==========

Or if you prefer researcher-speak, “Identity-related behavioral intentions that had been noticed by other people were translated into action less intensively than those that had been ignored.”

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 29 | bei Position 398-401 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 2. Dezember 2021 23:56:58

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 428-431 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 3. Dezember 2021 00:01:51

Duckworth says that what really drives success is not “genius” but a combination of passion and long-term perseverance. My definition of “grit” is: the ability to work hard and respond resiliently to failure and adversity; the inner quality that enables individuals to work hard and stick to their long-term passions and goals.

You just need yourself and a willingness to put in a tremendous amount of hard work, effort, and perseverance, because that is where talent comes from.

Winning Medals Doesn’t Feel That Good

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 469-471 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 3. Dezember 2021 00:06:19

When you put in the time and effort, when you make improvements, when you gain a certain level of skill, you become the thing that you’re trying to achieve. “Becoming” feels wonderful because you’ve earned it.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 477-478 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 3. Dezember 2021 00:06:58

You don’t just strive for success; you’re successful.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 478-481 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 3. Dezember 2021 00:07:15

And oddly enough, even though “becoming” is incredibly motivating, when you transform yourself into a leader or an entrepreneur or a runner or a musician or whatever you hope to be, you no longer need motivation. You don’t have to find the motivation or willpower; you do what you need to do because that’s who you are.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 36 | bei Position 481-483 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 3. Dezember 2021 00:07:31

Hopefully you see where this is going. Each little success is motivating. Each little success gives you confidence. The accumulation of small successes makes the process, um, maybe not fun, but definitely rewarding—and that’s all you need to keep going.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 36 | bei Position 483-486 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 3. Dezember 2021 00:08:06

And somehow, without noticing when it happens, you stop thinking about following your routine for three months or six months or a year. You just think about that day and what you will do that day. Somehow, without noticing when it happens, you embrace the routine and not the goal. Every day you get to feel good about yourself, and that sense and feeling of accomplishment motivates you to do it all over again the next day.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 36 | bei Position 489-491 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 3. Dezember 2021 00:08:35

Earned success is the best motivational tool of all. That feeling, that knowledge, is hugely energizing because it’s based not on wishing and hoping and dreaming but on a reality—a reality you created.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 37 | bei Position 494-496 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 3. Dezember 2021 00:09:24

You’ll stay motivated when you find a process you trust and commit to working that process for as little as a week. Forget how far you need to go to reach your goal; just commit to following the process for a week.

as you follow the right routine and gain a small—even very small—measure of skill, your motivation grows, your confidence grows, and your happiness grows, and those qualities make it easy to keep following the right routine, to keep improving, to keep gaining skill and confidence and motivation . . . because you will have earned those feelings.

CHAPTER 2 The Greater Your Focus, the Lower Your Chances of Success

you also may have fallen prey to the myth of focus, which says that the only way to be a high achiever is to regularly remind, coerce, and torture yourself into putting forth effort.

==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 40 | bei Position 521-522 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:28:27

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 40 | bei Position 526-528 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:28:36

==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 41 | bei Position 528-530 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:28:53

What happens when you turn “I want to” into “I have to”? You make it to work on time. Punctuality is nonnegotiable. Getting to work on time is not a goal; it’s a task. So is making dinner; you have no choice. So is taking care of your kids; it’s nonnegotiable.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 41 | bei Position 532-533 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:29:13

That’s why the power of routine, something we’ll look at in detail later, is so important. When you create a routine, embrace that routine, and see the results of that routine, you stop negotiating with yourself.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 41 | bei Position 532-535 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:29:29

That’s why the power of routine, something we’ll look at in detail later, is so important. When you create a routine, embrace that routine, and see the results of that routine, you stop negotiating with yourself. You see your routine as a task, in the best possible way: Your routine isn’t something you choose to do; it’s just what you do. And you stop making choices that don’t support your goals.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 41 | bei Position 536-537 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:29:44

TO REACH A GOAL, DON’T FOCUS ON THE GOAL
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 42 | bei Position 549-551 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:31:13

Instead, the main problem with setting a huge goal lies much less with caring and much more in two simple words: “here” and “there.” The distance from here, where you start, to there, where you someday want to be, is too great, especially at the beginning.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 43 | bei Position 559-560 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:31:52

So for Gosh Sakes, Don’t Always Keep Your Goal in Mind
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 44 | bei Position 562-565 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:32:28

Dreams are really important. They make us human. We dare to set nearly impossible goals. Yet all those imaginings are worthless without a process to help us achieve them. A dream, once born, quickly dies without a process to support it. Then a dream turns into a regret—and all of us already have too many of those.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 44 | bei Position 565-567 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:32:53

The key is to set a goal, use it as a target that helps you create a plan for achieving it . . . and then do your best to forget all about that goal. As I learned from James Clear, a leading thinker on the subject, the best use of a goal is to inform the process you will follow to achieve it.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 45 | bei Position 582-585 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:34:44

Everyone has goals. The people who actually achieve their goals create routines. They build systems. They consistently take the steps that, in time, will ensure they reach their ultimate goal. They don’t wish. They don’t hope. They just do what their plan says, consistently and without fail. They forget the goal and focus solely on the process.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 46 | bei Position 586-587 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 4. Dezember 2021 00:34:49

“I DON’T” ARE THE MAGIC WORDS FOR STAYING ON TRACK
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 90 | bei Position 1094-1095 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:22:10

Changing your behavior—especially when doing something different basically means saying no to something you normally do—is really hard.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 90 | bei Position 1100-1104 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:23:22

So what is the best way to say no to yourself? It’s easy: Stop saying “can’t” and start saying “don’t.” It works. Science says so. Researchers conducted a study: One group was given a simple temptation and told to say, in the face of that temptation, “I can’t do (that).” The other group was told to say, “I don’t do (that).”
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 91 | bei Position 1114-1115 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:24:31

Not only was “I can’t” less effective than “I don’t”; “I can’t” was less effective than using no strategy at all.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 92 | bei Position 1115-1118 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:25:52

Why? According to the researchers, “The refusal frame ‘I don’t’ is more persuasive than the refusal frame ‘I can’t’ because the former connotes conviction to a higher degree. . . . Perceived conviction mediates the influence of refusal frame on persuasiveness.”*
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 92 | bei Position 1125-1128 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:26:15

“I can’t” sounds tissue-paper thin because it’s a decision based on external reasons or causes. “I don’t” sounds like a brick wall because it comes from deep inside you. It’s part of your identity. It’s who you are. The power of “I don’t” extends to both your mind-set and the impression you make on others.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1128-1129 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:26:19

1. YOU CAN’T MAKE EXCUSES TO YOURSELF.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1130-1132 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:26:40

When you “can’t,” you automatically start to find excuses, reasons why you can. When you “don’t,” you automatically start to find ways to ensure you do—because that is the person you have become.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1135-1136 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:27:05

2. YOU COME ACROSS AS MORE CONFIDENT.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1142-1144 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:27:45

Use “I don’t” to ensure that what must be nonnegotiable remains nonnegotiable . . . and then shift to terms you are willing to negotiate.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1144-1145 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:27:54

3. YOU WON’T GET AS MUCH PUSHBACK ON YOUR RESOLUTIONS.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 97 | bei Position 1161-1162 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 00:30:04

HOW GOOD IS GOOD ENOUGH?
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 97 | bei Position 1166-1167 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 23:40:52

let’s pretend Malcolm Gladwell is right and it takes approximately ten thousand hours of focused effort to become an expert in a challenging pursuit or field.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1170-1171 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 23:41:16

then the average person will need to put in about forty hours a week for five years to become highly accomplished in their chosen pursuit.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1173-1174 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 23:42:15

We’re more likely to become “superior” in that career pursuit, not world-class, not top 0.01 percent, but definitely more skilled than 95 percent of the population.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1176-1178 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 23:42:43

Because the average person can successfully train to run a marathon in less than a year . . . when you think of it that way, achieving the rank of “superior” is an excellent alternative to applying Gladwellian levels of effort.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 1192-1194 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 23:44:22

Work too hard on any one aspect of your life and other aspects suffer. That’s why it’s so hard to be world-class at anything . . . much less at several things. And
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 1192-1196 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 23:44:32

Work too hard on any one aspect of your life and other aspects suffer. That’s why it’s so hard to be world-class at anything . . . much less at several things. And that’s why you don’t need to be world-class. Get to the 90 or 95 percent level in any pursuit and you will be extremely successful and will feel incredibly good about yourself. Perfection definitely isn’t required.
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 100 | bei Position 1203-1204 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 23:45:18

It’s Okay to Be a Tortoise
==========
The Motivation Myth (Haden, Jeff)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 100 | bei Position 1204-1205 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 8. Dezember 2021 23:45:59

Take a step back and think about your life in stages.

The Radish Experiment
==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 22 | bei Position 325-326 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:02:53

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 22 | bei Position 326-328 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:03:00

the young Dostoyevsky—bet that his younger brother couldn’t go five minutes without thinking about a white bear.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 25 | bei Position 376-377 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:13:08

We like to think we control our thoughts, but we don’t.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 25 | bei Position 380-382 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:13:50

Of all the traumas and psychoses afflicting humans, “unwanted white bear thoughts” doesn’t rank very high. Yet that distance from everyday life is precisely what makes it a useful tool to researchers.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 382-384 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:14:23

When a graduate student tried a version of Wegner’s experiment in which people were told not to think about their mothers, the experiment failed in its purpose, and served to demonstrate
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 382-385 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:14:28

When a graduate student tried a version of Wegner’s experiment in which people were told not to think about their mothers, the experiment failed in its purpose, and served to demonstrate only that college students are remarkably skilled at not thinking about their mothers.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 388-390 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:15:17

Mothers are not good topics for pure research, because there is so much baggage—so many mental and emotional associations. The reasons you do or don’t think about your mother are many, variable, and highly specific, so they would not easily generalize.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 388-392 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:15:29

Mothers are not good topics for pure research, because there is so much baggage—so many mental and emotional associations. The reasons you do or don’t think about your mother are many, variable, and highly specific, so they would not easily generalize. In contrast, if people have trouble suppressing thoughts of white bears—creatures that presumably play essentially no role in the daily life or personal history of the average American college student and research participant—then the explanation is likely to apply to a wide range of topics.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 393-394 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:16:19

after people spent a few minutes trying not to think of a white bear, they gave up sooner on puzzles (compared with people who’d been free to ponder anything). They also had a harder time controlling their feelings
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 400-400 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:20:51

Name That Feeling
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 401-401 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:21:06

Exactly what was willpower?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 404-405 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:21:44

Baumeister had to go all the way back to Freud to find a model of the self that incorporated concepts of energy.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 405-408 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:22:30

Freud’s ideas, as usual, turned out to be both remarkably prescient and utterly wrong. He theorized that humans use a process called sublimation to convert energy from its basic instinctual sources into more socially approved ones. Thus, Freud posited, great artists channel their sexual energy into their work. It was clever speculation, but the energy model of the self didn’t catch on with psychologists in the twentieth century, and neither did the specific theory about the sublimation mechanism.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 410-412 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:23:04

For example, if the theory of sublimation was correct, then artists’ colonies should be full of people sublimating their erotic urges, and therefore there should be relatively little sexual activity. Have you ever heard of an artists’ colony known for its lack of sex?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 415-417 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:23:56

As a kind of homage to Freud’s insights in this direction, Baumeister elected to use Freud’s term for the self: ego. Thus was born “ego depletion,” Baumeister’s term for describing people’s diminished capacity to regulate their thoughts, feelings, and actions. People can sometimes overcome mental fatigue, but Baumeister found that if
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 415-417 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:24:01

As a kind of homage to Freud’s insights in this direction, Baumeister elected to use Freud’s term for the self: ego. Thus was born “ego depletion,” Baumeister’s term for describing people’s diminished capacity to regulate their thoughts, feelings, and actions.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 415-418 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:24:30

As a kind of homage to Freud’s insights in this direction, Baumeister elected to use Freud’s term for the self: ego. Thus was born “ego depletion,” Baumeister’s term for describing people’s diminished capacity to regulate their thoughts, feelings, and actions. People can sometimes overcome mental fatigue, but Baumeister found that if they had used up energy by exerting willpower (or by making decisions, another form of ego depletion that we’ll discuss later), they would eventually succumb.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 424-425 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:25:37

researchers paid special attention to the brain region known as the anterior cingulate cortex, which watches for mismatches between what you are doing and what you intended to do.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 420-420 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:25:47

How ego depletion occurs inside the brain,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 425-425 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:25:59

detection system.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 424-425 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:26:02

researchers paid special attention to the brain region known as the anterior cingulate cortex, which watches for mismatches between what you are doing and what you intended to do. It’s commonly known as the conflict-monitoring system or the error-detection system.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 29 | bei Position 438-441 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:28:33

-monitoring system of the brain: The alarm signals for mismatches were weaker. The results showed that ego depletion causes a slowdown in the anterior cingulate cortex, the brain area that’s crucial to self-control. As the brain slows down and its error-detection ability deteriorates, people have trouble controlling their reactions. They must struggle to accomplish tasks that would get done much more easily if the ego weren’t depleted.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 442-443 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:29:07

What are the noticeable symptoms—something to warn you that your brain is not primed for control
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 451-452 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:31:15

while depleted persons (once again) didn’t show any single telltale emotion, they did react more strongly to all kinds of things.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 453-453 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:31:44

Desires intensified along with feelings.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 455-456 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:32:07

So if you’d like some advance warning of trouble, look not for a single symptom but rather for a change in the overall intensity of your feelings.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 459-462 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:32:41

If you’re trying to resist temptation, you may find yourself feeling the forbidden desires more strongly just when your ability to resist them is down. Ego depletion thus creates a double whammy: Your willpower is diminished and your cravings feel stronger than ever.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 462-462 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:33:39

The problem can be particularly acute for people struggling with addiction.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 471-471 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:34:07

The Mystery of the Dirty Socks
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 472-474 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:35:33

He assumed he’d find a positive correlation between “turns in school assignments on time” and “wears clean socks,” because both would stem from the underlying trait of conscientiousness. But when he collected data from students at Stanford, where he taught, he was surprised to find a hefty negative correlation.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 477-477 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:35:56

possibility that the students were suffering from the sort of ego depletion
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 478-480 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:36:33

As hypothesized, the students performed relatively badly near the end of the term, apparently because their willpower had been depleted by the strain of studying for exams and turning in assignments.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 481-482 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:36:40

All sorts of good habits were forsaken as the students’ self-control waned during exam period.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 491-492 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:37:58

Some students even reported that their study habits got worse during exam time, which couldn’t have been their intention.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 494-497 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:38:49

They were also more grumpy, irritable, and prone to anger or despair. They may have blamed their outbursts on the stress of exam period, because there’s a common misperception that stress causes those kinds of emotions. What stress really does, though, is deplete willpower, which diminishes your ability to control those emotions.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 497-498 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:39:21

The effects of ego depletion were recently demonstrated even more precisely in the beeper study
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 499-500 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:39:52

the more willpower people expended, the more likely they became to yield to the next temptation that came along.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 499-500 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:40:14

the more willpower people expended, the more likely they became to yield to the next temptation that came along.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 501-502 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:40:20

particularly if the new temptation came soon after a previous one.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 503-504 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:41:57

I just don’t have enough willpower. But earlier in the day, or earlier in the semester, they’d all had enough willpower to resist similar temptations. What had happened to it?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 505-506 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:42:04

Maybe people didn’t simply run out of willpower. Maybe they consciously or unconsciously hoarded it.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 507-510 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:43:50

He began, as usual, with a round of exercises to deplete the subjects’ willpower. Then, when he prepared them for the second round, testing their perseverance, he warned them that there would later be an additional third round featuring more tasks to perform. People reacted by slacking off on the second round. Consciously or unconsciously, they were conserving energy for the final push.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 507-512 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:44:02

He began, as usual, with a round of exercises to deplete the subjects’ willpower. Then, when he prepared them for the second round, testing their perseverance, he warned them that there would later be an additional third round featuring more tasks to perform. People reacted by slacking off on the second round. Consciously or unconsciously, they were conserving energy for the final push. Then Muraven tried another variation in the second round of the experiment. Before testing people’s perseverance, he informed them that they could win money by doing well. The cash worked wonders. People immediately found reserves to perform well. Watching the experimental subjects persevere, you’d never have known that their willpower had been depleted earlier.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 515-517 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 4. April 2022 10:44:19

He waited until after their stellar performance to inform them that they weren’t quite done yet—there’d be another round of perseverance tests. Since they hadn’t been warned ahead of time, they hadn’t conserved any energy, and it showed in their exceptionally bad performances.
==========

2.
Where does the Power in Willpower Come from?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 42 | bei Position 621-622 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. April 2022 21:50:54

Chips and circuit boards are useless without a source of energy. So is the brain.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 43 | bei Position 629-629 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. April 2022 21:51:02

Brain Fuel
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 44 | bei Position 645-648 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. April 2022 21:54:02

The link between glucose and self-control appeared in studies of people with hypoglycemia, the tendency to have low blood sugar. Researchers noted that hypoglycemics were more likely than the average person to have trouble concentrating and controlling their negative emotions when provoked. Overall, they tended to be more anxious and less happy than average. Hypoglycemia was also reported to be unusually prevalent among criminals and other violent persons,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 46 | bei Position 672-677 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 11. April 2022 21:58:02

Researchers testing personality have found that diabetics tend to be more impulsive and have more explosive temperaments than other people their age. They’re more likely to get distracted while working on a time-consuming task. They have more problems with alcohol abuse, anxiety, and depression. In hospitals and other institutions, diabetics throw more tantrums than other patients. In everyday life, stressful conditions seem to be harder on diabetics. Coping with stress typically takes self-control, and that’s difficult if your body isn’t providing your brain with enough fuel.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 711-711 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. April 2022 00:12:32

No glucose, no willpower: The pattern showed up time and again as researchers tested more people in more situations.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 50 | bei Position 739-742 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. April 2022 00:16:49

They helped resolve the puzzle over how glucose could work without global changes in the brain’s total energy use. Apparently ego depletion shifts activity from one part of the brain to another. Your brain does not stop working when glucose is low. It stops doing some things and starts doing others. That may help explain why depleted people feel things more intensely than normal: Certain parts of the brain go into high gear just as others taper off.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 50 | bei Position 739-745 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. April 2022 00:17:36

They helped resolve the puzzle over how glucose could work without global changes in the brain’s total energy use. Apparently ego depletion shifts activity from one part of the brain to another. Your brain does not stop working when glucose is low. It stops doing some things and starts doing others. That may help explain why depleted people feel things more intensely than normal: Certain parts of the brain go into high gear just as others taper off. As the body uses glucose during self-control, it starts to crave sweet things to eat—which is bad news for people hoping to use their self-control to avoid sweets. When people have more demands for self-control in their daily lives, their hunger for sweets increases. It’s not a simple matter of wanting all food more—they seem to be specifically hungry for sweets.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 51 | bei Position 748-749 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. April 2022 00:18:26

Still, the discovery of the glucose effect does point to some useful techniques for self-control.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 51 | bei Position 747-749 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. April 2022 00:18:35

The body may crave sweets as the quickest way to get energy, but low-sugar, high-protein foods and other nutritious fare work just as well (albeit more slowly). Still, the discovery of the glucose effect does point to some useful techniques for self-control.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 51 | bei Position 750-750 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. April 2022 00:18:42

Inner Demons
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 53 | bei Position 776-787 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 12. April 2022 00:24:14

In any case, there’s now a solid physiological explanation for PMS that doesn’t involve any mysterious alien impulses. During this premenstrual part of the cycle, which is called the luteal phase, the female body starts channeling a high amount of its energy to the ovaries and to related activities, like producing extra quantities of female hormones. As more energy and glucose are diverted to the reproductive system, there’s less available for the rest of the body, which responds by craving more fuel. Chocolate and other sweets are immediately appealing because they provide instant glucose, but any kind of food can help, which is why women report more food cravings and tend to eat more. One study found that the average woman eats about 810 calories at lunch during this time, which is about 170 calories more than what she eats at lunch during the rest of the month. But most women still aren’t getting enough extra calories. The typical woman in a modern thin-conscious society like America does not take in enough extra food to supply the body’s increased demands for glucose during these few days each month. When there isn’t enough energy to go around, the body has to ration it, and the reproductive system takes priority, leaving less glucose available for willpower. As a general rule, women are less likely than men to suffer from lapses of self-control, but their self-control problems do worsen during the luteal phase, as studies have repeatedly shown.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 55 | bei Position 810-813 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:23:59

women report during the luteal phase: They’re affected by a variety of feelings, and their problems often arise from a strong reaction to some event. They say they don’t want to get upset but can’t seem to stop themselves from getting worked up over minor things. They’re not consciously aware that their body has abruptly cut the fuel supply for self-control, so they’re surprised that normal controls don’t work as usual.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 56 | bei Position 819-821 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:25:05

We don’t want to exaggerate these problems, because most women cope quite well with PMS at work and at home, and we certainly don’t want to suggest that women have weaker willpower than men. To repeat, women on the whole have fewer problems with self-control than men:
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 57 | bei Position 831-831 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:26:08

When you eat, go for the slow burn.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 58 | bei Position 858-859 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:35:48

To maintain steady self-control, you’re better off eating foods with a low glycemic index:
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 59 | bei Position 864-864 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:36:32

When you’re sick, save your glucose for your immune system.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 59 | bei Position 864-867 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:36:53

The next time you’re preparing to drag your aching body to work, here’s something to consider: Driving a car with a bad cold has been found to be even more dangerous than driving when mildly intoxicated. That’s because your immune system is using so much of your glucose to fight the cold that there’s not enough left for the brain.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 59 | bei Position 868-869 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:37:33

Sometimes the job has to be muddled through, but don’t trust the glucose-deprived brain for anything important.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 59 | bei Position 868-870 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:37:43

Sometimes the job has to be muddled through, but don’t trust the glucose-deprived brain for anything important. If you simply can’t miss a meeting at work, try to avoid any topics that will strain your self-control. If there’s a make-or-break project under your supervision, don’t make any irrevocable decisions.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 59 | bei Position 871-872 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:38:02

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 59 | bei Position 873-874 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:38:39

==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 60 | bei Position 880-881 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:39:27

To get the most out of your willpower, use it to set aside enough time to sleep. You’ll behave better the next day—and sleep more easily the next night.
==========
