3.
A Brief History of the To-Do List, from God to Drew Carey
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 62 | bei Position 903-905 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:41:59

The first step in self-control is to set a clear goal. The technical term researchers use for self-control is self-regulation, and the “regulation” part highlights the importance of a goal.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 62 | bei Position 903-907 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:42:24

The first step in self-control is to set a clear goal. The technical term researchers use for self-control is self-regulation, and the “regulation” part highlights the importance of a goal. Regulating means changing, but only a particular kind of intentional, meaningful changing. To regulate is to guide toward a specific goal or standard: the speed limit for cars on a highway, the maximum height for an office building. Self-control without goals and other standards would be nothing more than aimless change,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 63 | bei Position 908-908 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:42:48

For most of us, though, the problem is not a lack of goals but rather too many of them.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 63 | bei Position 911-912 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:43:56

We can be even more unrealistic in setting longer-term goals.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 958-959 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:50:23

When asked by researchers to list their personal goals, most people have no trouble coming up with at least fifteen separate ones.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 959-960 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:50:34

support each other, like a goal
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 958-960 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:50:40

When asked by researchers to list their personal goals, most people have no trouble coming up with at least fifteen separate ones. Some can dovetail well and support each other, like a goal to quit smoking and a goal to spend less money. But there are inevitably conflicts between work and family goals.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 966-967 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:50:58

The result of conflicting goals is unhappiness instead of action,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 67 | bei Position 972-972 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:51:39

First, you worry a lot.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 67 | bei Position 973-974 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:51:59

The more competing demands you face, the more time you spend contemplating these demands. You’re beset by rumination: repetitive thoughts that are largely involuntary and not especially pleasant.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 67 | bei Position 974-974 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:52:03

Second, you get less done.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 67 | bei Position 974-977 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:52:24

It might seem that people who think more about their goals would also take more steps to reach them, but instead they replace action with rumination. The researchers found that people with clear, unconflicting goals tended to forge ahead and make progress, but the rest were so busy worrying that they got stuck.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 67 | bei Position 977-977 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:52:30

Third, your health suffers, physically as well as mentally.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 68 | bei Position 984-985 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:53:28

Which Goals?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 69 | bei Position 1000-1001 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:55:32

shortened temporal horizon has been demonstrated over and over in addicts of all kinds.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 69 | bei Position 1005-1005 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:56:26

(The only exception was, once again, marijuana;
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 69 | bei Position 1010-1010 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:57:07

Ignoring the long term is hazardous to your health, both physically and fiscally.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 1014-1016 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 00:58:02

For decades, psychologists have been debating the merits of proximal goals (which are short-term objectives) versus distal goals (which are long-term objectives).
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 70 | bei Position 1024-1026 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 01:01:21

It turned out that the distal goals were no better than having no goals at all. Only the proximal goals produced improvements in learning, self-efficacy, and performance.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 71 | bei Position 1031-1031 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 01:02:01

distal goals also seemed to be more useful than present-oriented goals,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 71 | bei Position 1032-1033 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 01:02:09

Why did the long-term objectives work with these high school students but not in the earlier study with the arithmetic lessons? One reason is that the high school students could clearly see a connection between their daily tasks and their long-term goals.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 71 | bei Position 1035-1036 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 01:02:21

Another reason is that older children are better able than younger ones to think about the future.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 72 | bei Position 1041-1041 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 13. April 2022 01:02:32

Fuzzy Versus Fussy
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 72 | bei Position 1051-1055 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 14. April 2022 00:08:35

Daily plans do have the advantage of letting the person know exactly what he or she should be doing at each moment. But their preparation is time-consuming, because it takes much longer to make thirty daily plans than a broad plan for the month without any daily details. Another drawback of daily plans is that they lack flexibility. They deprive the person of the chance to make choices along the way, so the person feels locked into a rigid and grinding sequence of tasks. Life rarely goes exactly according to plan, and so the daily plans can be demoralizing as soon as you fall off schedule. With a monthly plan, you can make adjustments. If a delay arises one day, your plan is still intact.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 75 | bei Position 1085-1085 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 14. April 2022 00:13:05

Drew Carey’s Dream In-Box
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 76 | bei Position 1106-1107 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 14. April 2022 00:16:05

It’s a system involving a mental phenomenon that psychologists recognized decades ago—your inner nag—but that wasn’t really understood until some recent experiments in Baumeister’s laboratory testing ways to silence that inner voice.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 78 | bei Position 1140-1142 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 14. April 2022 00:21:57

Besides getting paperwork off the desk, the tickler file also removed a source of worry: Once something was filed there, you knew you’d be reminded to deal with it on the appropriate day. You weren’t nagged by the fear that you’d lose it or forget about it.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 80 | bei Position 1168-1170 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 14. April 2022 00:25:22

As yet there’s no body of peer-reviewed research comparing GTDers with a control group. But there is evidence in the psychological literature of the mental stress that Allen observed. Psychologists have also been studying how to eliminate the monkey mind. They just use a different term for it.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 80 | bei Position 1170-1171 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 14. April 2022 00:25:29

The Zeigarnik Effect
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 81 | bei Position 1180-1182 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:06:21

Uncompleted tasks and unmet goals tend to pop into one’s mind. Once the task is completed and the goal reached, however, this stream of reminders comes to a stop.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 83 | bei Position 1216-1217 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:11:15

it turns out that the Zeigarnik effect is not, as was assumed for decades, a reminder that continues unabated until the task gets done.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 84 | bei Position 1218-1220 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:11:27

the unconscious is asking the conscious mind to make a plan. The unconscious mind apparently can’t do this on its own, so it nags the conscious mind to make a plan with specifics like time, place, and opportunity. Once the plan is formed, the unconscious can stop nagging the conscious mind with reminders.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 84 | bei Position 1226-1226 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:12:22

Zero Euphoria
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 86 | bei Position 1260-1264 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:17:21

“When we’re trying to decide what to do with our stuff or what movie to see,” Allen says, “we don’t think to ourselves, Look at all these cool choices. There’s a powerful thing inside that says, If I decide to do that movie, I kill all the other movies. You can pretend all the way up to that point that you know the right thing to do, but once you’re faced with a choice, you have to deal with this open loop in your head: You’re wrong, you’re right, you’re wrong, you’re right. Every single time you make a choice, you’re stepping into an existential void.”
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 88 | bei Position 1267-1268 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:17:32

4.
Decision Fatigue
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 90 | bei Position 1302-1302 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:22:27

The problem of decision fatigue affects everything
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 90 | bei Position 1303-1303 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:22:36

Yet few people are even aware of it.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1341-1342 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:27:47

What kinds of decisions deplete the most willpower? Which choices are the hardest?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1342-1342 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. April 2022 00:27:53

Crossing the Rubicon
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1342-1343 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:34:16

Psychologists distinguish two main types of mental processes, automatic and controlled. Automatic processes, like multiplying 4 times 7, can be done without exertion.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1345-1347 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:35:04

Difficult mathematical calculations, like other logical reasoning, require willpower as you follow a set of systematic rules to get from one set of information to something new. You often go through steps like these in making a decision, through a process that psychologists call the Rubicon model of action phases
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1352-1353 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:36:47

The whole process could deplete anyone’s willpower, but which part is most fatiguing? Could the depletion be due mainly to all the calculations before the decision?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1365-1365 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:38:57

They had to cast the die, and that turned out to be the most fatiguing task of all.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1366-1368 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:39:01

Crossing the Rubicon appeared to be tough mental work, whether it involved deciding the fate of an empire or the size of a computer drive.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1368-1369 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:39:10

But suppose the choice involved options easier and more appealing than starting a civil war or contemplating the innards of a computer. Suppose it involved a process that you found entertaining. Would those choices still deplete willpower?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1373-1376 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:40:14

As you might expect, the process wasn’t as depleting for the ones who enjoyed it—but only up to a point. If the participants were given a short list of choices to be made in four minutes, then the ones who liked picking gifts could zip through without depleting any of their willpower, whereas the registry-dreading group was predictably depleted even by that short exercise. But when the list was longer and the process went on for twelve minutes, both groups were equally depleted
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1377-1379 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:40:25

A few pleasant decisions are apparently not all that depleting, but in the long run, there seems to be no such thing as a free choice, at least when it comes to making it for yourself.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1379-1379 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:40:51

Choosing for others, though, isn’t always so difficult.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1381-1382 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:41:02

results showed that it was much less depleting to decide for a casual acquaintance than for oneself.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1381-1383 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:41:16

results showed that it was much less depleting to decide for a casual acquaintance than for oneself. Even though it might seem difficult to choose a sofa for an acquaintance whose taste you don’t know, that difficulty is apparently offset by not caring a great deal about the outcome.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 96 | bei Position 1385-1385 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:41:30

The Judge’s Dilemma (and the Prisoner’s Distress)
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1422-1423 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:46:14

As the judges made one decision after another, their brains and bodies used up glucose, that crucial component of willpower that we discussed earlier.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1424-1425 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:46:21

they tended to go for the less risky choice (for themselves, anyway).
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1426-1426 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:46:32

such bias is not an isolated phenomenon. It occurs naturally in all kinds of situations.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1426-1427 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:46:43

The link between willpower and decision making works both ways: Decision making depletes your willpower, and once your willpower is depleted, you’re less able to make decisions.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 98 | bei Position 1428-1429 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:47:10

You’ll look for excuses to avoid or postpone decisions. You’ll look for the easiest and safest option, which often is to stick with the status quo:
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 1432-1433 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:47:54

Part of the resistance against making decisions comes from the fear of giving up options. The more you give up by deciding, the more you’re afraid of cutting off something vital.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 1435-1436 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:48:15

there’s abundant research showing that people have a hard time giving up options, even when the options aren’t doing them any good.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 1436-1438 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:48:29

This reluctance to give up options becomes more pronounced when willpower is low. It takes willpower to make decisions, and so the depleted state makes people look for ways to postpone or evade decisions.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 101 | bei Position 1476-1477 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:54:24

Closing a door on an option is experienced as a loss, and people are willing to pay a price to avoid the emotion of loss,”
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 1477-1478 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:54:47

Sometimes that makes sense, but too often we’re so eager to keep options open that we don’t see the long-term price that we’re paying—or that others are paying.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 1481-1481 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:55:00

Lazy Choices
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 1482-1483 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 16. April 2022 00:55:40

The ability to compromise is a particularly advanced and difficult form of decision making—and therefore one of the first abilities to decline when our willpower is depleted,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 1487-1489 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:14:06

Above a certain point, increases in price are not worth the gains in quality. Choosing that point is the optimal decision. But it requires the difficult task of figuring out just where that point is.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 1487-1491 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:14:35

Above a certain point, increases in price are not worth the gains in quality. Choosing that point is the optimal decision. But it requires the difficult task of figuring out just where that point is. When your willpower is low, you’re less able to make these trade-offs. You become what researchers call a “cognitive miser,” hoarding your energy by avoiding compromises. You’re liable to look at only one dimension,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 104 | bei Position 1518-1518 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:18:38

Choose Your Prize
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1524-1526 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:19:41

Being able to resist short-term temptations in favor of long-term payoffs is the secret not just to wealth but to civilization itself. It took singular willpower for the first farmers to go out and plant seeds instead of treating themselves to an immediate meal.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1543-1546 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:22:48

Men who saw photos of hot women shifted toward getting an immediate reward instead of waiting for a larger payoff in the future. Apparently, the sight of an attractive woman makes men want cash right away. They focus on the present rather than the future. This effect is probably deeply rooted in the psyche and in the evolutionary past.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1546-1547 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:23:23

most men in the past did not leave a line of descendants—their odds of reproducing were only half as high as the typical woman’s.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1548-1549 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:23:36

Men today are therefore descended from the minority of men who managed to reproduce, and their brains seem primed for a quick response to any opportunity to improve their reproductive odds.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1548-1554 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:24:19

Men today are therefore descended from the minority of men who managed to reproduce, and their brains seem primed for a quick response to any opportunity to improve their reproductive odds. Other studies have shown that the sight of an attractive woman (but not an unattractive woman) activates the male brain’s nucleus accumbens, which is connected to the part of the brain activated by rewards like cash and sweet-tasting foods. In the past, there might well have been some evolutionary advantage in going for a quick display of resources upon seeing an attractive female; today, it might still be useful on occasions, especially if you think the woman’s decision might be affected by your owning a hot car. Clearly that’s the strategy of marketers of upscale cars and other goods. Advertising agencies figured out long ago that men are more likely to splurge on a luxury product if it’s shown next to a beautiful woman.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 108 | bei Position 1559-1559 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:25:05

5.
Where have all the Dollars Gone?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 108 | bei Position 1559-1561 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 17. April 2022 01:25:26

The Quantified Self Knows
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 111 | bei Position 1606-1607 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 18. April 2022 00:19:58

What’s the point of self-awareness if it makes you feel miserable?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 111 | bei Position 1607-1607 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 18. April 2022 00:20:03

I’m Self-aware, Therefore I … ?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1617-1619 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 18. April 2022 00:22:41

Self-awareness always seemed to involve comparing the self to these ideas of what one might, or should, or could, be. The two psychologists came up with a word for these ideas: standards. Self-awareness involves a process of comparing yourself to standards.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 111 | bei Position 1610-1613 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 18. April 2022 00:23:00

When people were placed in front of a mirror, or told that their actions were being filmed, they consistently changed their behavior. These self-conscious people worked harder at laboratory tasks. They gave more valid answers to questionnaires (meaning that their answers jibed more closely with their actual behavior). They were more consistent in their actions, and their actions were also more consistent with their values.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1630-1630 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 18. April 2022 00:24:30

Self-awareness evolved because it helps self-regulation.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1628-1629 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 18. April 2022 00:24:36

Nature doesn’t really care whether you feel good. It selects for traits that improve survival and reproduction. What good is self-awareness for that?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1646-1650 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 18. April 2022 00:27:13

Our ancestors lived in groups that rewarded members for living up to the common values, norms, and ideals. Therefore, people who could adjust their actions to meet those standards fared better than the ones who were oblivious to their own social faux pas. Changing personal behavior to meet standards requires willpower, but willpower without self-awareness is as useless as a cannon commanded by a blind man. That’s why self-awareness evolved as an innate trait among our early ancestors on the savanna—and why it has kept developing recently in more treacherous social environs.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1650-1651 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:00:22

The Quantified Self
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 117 | bei Position 1690-1692 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:07:08

In 2008, Kevin Kelly and Gary Wolf created a Web site called Quantified Self, or QS, catering to users of self-regulation technology. The QS movement is still small and heavily geeky, but already it has spread far from Silicon Valley, and devotees in cities around the world are convening—in person—to talk gadgets, share data, and encourage one another.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 118 | bei Position 1704-1706 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:08:16

Thanks to companies like Mint.com, it’s easier than ever for people to follow Charles Darwin’s advice about tracking finances, but these new tools are doing more than just the grunt work of monitoring behavior.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 118 | bei Position 1706-1707 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:09:50

Keeping track is the first step, but it’s not necessarily enough.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 118 | bei Position 1712-1714 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:10:53

Once you let Mint look at your banking and credit card transactions, it categorizes them to show where your money is going—and whether you’re spending more than you make. Mint can’t force you to change your habits (the computers can only read your records, not touch your money), but it can make you think twice.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 118 | bei Position 1717-1718 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:11:43

You can establish a variety of short-term and long-term goals—taking a vacation, buying a home, saving up for retirement—and then get progress reports.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 119 | bei Position 1721-1722 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:11:58

This quantifies how your short-term behavior affects the long-term goals so you have a chance of actually budgeting in a way that makes a difference.”
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 119 | bei Position 1722-1724 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:12:32

No one knows exactly how well this works yet, because Mint is a commercial operation, not a controlled experiment. But there are already some encouraging signs, as we found when we asked the Mint research staff to look for broad trends in people’s spending habits before and after they joined Mint.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 119 | bei Position 1726-1729 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:13:12

For the great majority (80 percent) of people, the upward trajectory of their spending was tempered after they joined Mint and began monitoring their transactions. And most people’s spending was further tempered if they used the information to set up budgets and goals on Mint. The biggest effects were observed in people’s spending on groceries, restaurants, and credit card finance charges—some very sensible categories for cutting back.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 119 | bei Position 1730-1734 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:13:49

“If you cut too hard and too fast, you’ll never stick with it and you’ll hate yourself,” Patzer says. “If you’re spending $500 a month on restaurants and you try to set a new budget of $200, you’ll end up saying, ‘Forget that!’ It’s too hard. But if you reduce to $450 or $400, you can make that without radically changing your lifestyle. Then the next month you can go another $50 or $100. Keep the monthly changes to 20 percent until you get things under control.”
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1734-1735 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:13:55

Not-So-Invidious Comparisons
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1735-1737 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:14:17

Once you’ve taken the first two steps in self-control—setting a goal and monitoring your behavior—you’re confronted with a perennial question: Should you focus on how far you’ve come or how much remains to be done? There’s no simple, universal answer, but it does make a difference,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1743-1746 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:15:29

For contentment, apparently, it pays to look at how far you’ve come. To stoke motivation and ambition, focus instead on the road ahead. Either way, you can gain additional benefits by comparing yourself with others, and that’s never been easier to do, thanks to the abundance of networked data.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1751-1752 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:16:17

These sorts of comparisons become even more powerful when you start openly sharing your data with others.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1755-1759 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:17:09

Public information has more impact than private information. People care more about what other people know about them than about what they know about themselves. A failure, a slipup, a lapse in self-control can be swept under the carpet pretty easily if you’re the only one who knows about it. You can rationalize it or just plain ignore it. But if other people know about it, it’s harder to dismiss. After all, the other person might not buy the excuses that you make, even though you find them quite satisfying. And you’ll have even more trouble selling that excuse when you expand from one person to a whole social network.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1760-1761 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:17:20

You’re also outsourcing the job of monitoring, which can ease the burden on yourself.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1761-1761 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:17:31

An outsider can often encourage you by pointing out signs of progress that you’ve taken for granted.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1762-1763 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:18:17

One popular QS application, Moodscope, was developed by an entrepreneur battling depression who wanted help monitoring his condition. He devised an application that lets him take a quick daily test to gauge his mood.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 122 | bei Position 1774-1778 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:19:56

Behavioral economists have found that neurotic penny-pinching may be even more prevalent than neurotic overspending, affecting some one in five people. Brain scans have similarly pinpointed the culprit: an insula that reacts with hyperactive horror at the prospect of parting with cash. The result is a condition that researchers call hyperopia (the opposite of myopia), in which you focus too much on the future at the expense of the present.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 122 | bei Position 1779-1780 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:20:15

The studies show that tightwads aren’t any happier than spendthrifts, and that they suffer a case of saver’s remorse when they look back on all the opportunities they passed up.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 124 | bei Position 1782-1783 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:20:34

6.
Can Willpower be Strengthened?
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 124 | bei Position 1783-1784 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 20. April 2022 00:23:09

(Preferably Without Feeling David Blaine’s Pain)
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 128 | bei Position 1845-1849 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 22. April 2022 23:58:21

“Getting your brain wired into little goals and achieving them, that helps you achieve the bigger things you shouldn’t be able to do,” he said. “It’s not just practicing the specific thing. It’s always making things more difficult than they should be, and never falling short, so that you have that extra reserve, that tank, so you know you can always go further than your goal. For me that’s what discipline is. It’s repetition and practice.”
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 129 | bei Position 1855-1856 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 22. April 2022 23:59:23

Willpower Workouts
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1882-1884 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:03:03

Emotional control typically relies on various subtle tricks, such as changing how one thinks about the problem at hand, or distracting oneself. Hence, practicing emotional control does not strengthen your willpower.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1884-1884 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:03:44

But other exercises do help,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1887-1887 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:03:59

the best results came from the group working on posture.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1888-1891 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:04:17

By overriding their habit of slouching, the students strengthened their willpower and did better at tasks that had nothing to do with posture. The improvement was most pronounced among the students who had followed the advice most diligently (as measured by the daily logs the students kept of how often they’d forced themselves to sit up or stand up straight).
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1891-1891 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:04:27

The experiment also revealed an important distinction in self-control between two kinds of strength: power and stamina.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1894-1898 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:05:28

when they returned to the lab after working on their posture, their scores on the initial handgrip tests didn’t show much improvement, meaning that the willpower muscle hadn’t gotten more powerful. But they had much more stamina, as evidenced by their improved performance on the subsequent handgrip test administered after the researchers tried to fatigue them. Thanks to the students’ posture exercises, their willpower didn’t get depleted as quickly as before, so they had more stamina for other tasks.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 132 | bei Position 1899-1901 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:05:55

There’s nothing magical about sitting up straight, as researchers subsequently discovered when they tested other regimens and found similar benefits. You can pick and choose from the techniques they studied, or extrapolate to create your own system. The key is to concentrate on changing a habitual behavior.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 132 | bei Position 1901-1901 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:06:08

One simple way to start is by using a different hand for routine tasks.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 132 | bei Position 1907-1909 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:07:03

(Note to lefties: This strategy may not be as effective for you, because many left-handed people are actually fairly ambidextrous and have had more practice using their right hands in a world oriented for right-handed people. So using your right hand may not do as much for your willpower: No strain, no gain.)
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 132 | bei Position 1909-1910 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:07:23

Another training strategy is to change your speech habits,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 133 | bei Position 1916-1916 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:08:04

you may find it tough to keep up these techniques for very long.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 133 | bei Position 1916-1917 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:08:25

Sticking to arcane exercises that don’t offer an obvious reward can be a daunting challenge,
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 133 | bei Position 1923-1924 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:09:21

From Strength to More Strength
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 135 | bei Position 1950-1951 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:13:05

(that is, on the last self-control test administered at each lab session). Thus, exercise increased people’s stamina, allowing them to hold out against temptations even when their mental resources had been depleted.

Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 137 | bei Position 1973-1974 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:16:23

==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 137 | bei Position 1973-1976 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:16:54

All in all, these findings point toward the remarkable benefits of exercising willpower. Without realizing it, people gained a wide array of benefits in areas of their lives that had nothing to do with the specific exercises they were performing. And the lab tests provided an explanation: Their willpower gradually got stronger, so it was less readily depleted. Focusing on one specific form of self-control could yield much larger benefits,
==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 137 | bei Position 1977-1978 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 23. April 2022 00:17:19

The Toughest Stunt of All
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 138 | bei Position 1996-1998 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 24. April 2022 00:32:44

I say to myself, Oh, man, I’m not done with this until ten P.M. That’s eight more hours! I tell myself it won’t be so bad once there’s only six hours left, so I just have to get through the next two hours. That’s the kind of time-shift technique I use to change perspective so I get through these stunts.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)

Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 149 | bei Position 2142-2143 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:09:23

Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 150 | bei Position 2152-2153 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:10:43

We’ve said that willpower is humans’ greatest strength, but the best strategy is not to rely on it in all situations.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 150 | bei Position 2154-2156 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:11:04

there are mental tricks that enable you to conserve willpower for those moments when it’s indispensable. Paradoxically, these techniques require willpower to implement, but in the long run they leave you less depleted for those moments when it takes a strong core to survive.

The Ties That Bind
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 151 | bei Position 2168-2171 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:13:14

But the act of writing it was part of a strategy to conserve willpower that he used over and over with great success: precommitment. The essence of this strategy is to lock yourself into a virtuous path. You recognize that you’ll face terrible temptations to stray from the path, and that your willpower will weaken. So you make it impossible—or somehow unthinkably disgraceful or sinful—to leave the path. Precommitment is what Odysseus and his men used to get past the deadly songs
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 151 | bei Position 2168-2171 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:13:21

But the act of writing it was part of a strategy to conserve willpower that he used over and over with great success: precommitment. The essence of this strategy is to lock yourself into a virtuous path. You recognize that you’ll face terrible temptations to stray from the path, and that your willpower will weaken. So you make it impossible—or somehow unthinkably disgraceful or sinful—to leave the path.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 151 | bei Position 2173-2174 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:14:10

They prevented themselves from being tempted at all, which is generally the safer of the two approaches
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 152 | bei Position 2185-2192 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:16:59

Today you don’t need to be famous to worry about ruining your image with a lapse in willpower. You can precommit yourself to virtue by using social-networking tools that will expose your sins, like the “Public Humiliation Diet” followed by a writer named Drew Magary. He vowed to weigh himself every day and promptly reveal the results on Twitter—which he did, and lost sixty pounds in five months. If you’d rather put someone else in charge of the humiliation, you could install software from Covenant Eyes that will track your Web browsing and then e-mail a list of the sites you visit to anyone you designate in advance—like, say, your boss or your spouse. Or you could sign a “Commitment Contract” with stickK.com, a company founded by two Yale economists, Ian Ayres and Dean Karlan, and a graduate student, Jordan Goldberg. It allows you to pick any goal you want—lose weight, stop biting your nails, use fewer fossil fuels, stop calling an ex—along with a penalty that will be imposed automatically if you don’t reach it.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 2198-2201 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:17:38

People who draw up a contract without a financial penalty or a referee succeed only 35 percent of the time, whereas the ones with a penalty and a ref succeed nearly 80 percent of the time, and the ones who risk more than one hundred dollars do better than those who risk less than twenty dollars—at least according to what is reported to stickK.com, which doesn’t independently verify the results.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 2202-2203 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:18:03

And whatever the success rate, this is obviously a self-selected sample of people already motivated to change, so it’s hard to know exactly how much difference the stickK.com contracts make.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 2198-2203 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:18:06

People who draw up a contract without a financial penalty or a referee succeed only 35 percent of the time, whereas the ones with a penalty and a ref succeed nearly 80 percent of the time, and the ones who risk more than one hundred dollars do better than those who risk less than twenty dollars—at least according to what is reported to stickK.com, which doesn’t independently verify the results. The true success rate is presumably lower because some referees are reluctant to report failures that would hurt their friends financially. And whatever the success rate, this is obviously a self-selected sample of people already motivated to change, so it’s hard to know exactly how much difference the stickK.com contracts make.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 153 | bei Position 2203-2204 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:18:20

But the efficacy of contracts with monitors and penalties has been independently demonstrated
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 154 | bei Position 2220-2221 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:20:21

What began as a precommitment turned into something permanent and more valuable: a habit.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 154 | bei Position 2221-2221 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:20:27

The Brain on Autopilot
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 156 | bei Position 2243-2246 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:23:59

decent an appearance as possible, both for self-discipline and for self-respect.” Now, you might think the energy spent shaving in the jungle would be better devoted to looking for food. Wouldn’t that exercise of self-control leave you more depleted and less able to exert willpower for something vital? But orderly habits like that can actually improve self-control in the long run by triggering automatic mental processes that don’t require much energy.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 156 | bei Position 2246-2247 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:24:09

the link between external order and inner self-discipline has been confirmed recently in some remarkable studies.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 157 | bei Position 2258-2260 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:26:43

By shaving every day, Stanley could benefit from this same sort of orderly cue without having to expend much mental energy. He didn’t have to make a conscious decision every morning to shave. Once he had expended the willpower to make it his custom, it became a relatively automatic mental process requiring little or no further willpower.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 157 | bei Position 2265-2266 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:27:27

The people with high self-control were distinguished by their behaviors that took place more or less automatically.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 157 | bei Position 2269-2270 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:27:58

The behaviors they had coded as automatic tended to be linked to habits, whereas the more controlled sorts of behaviors tended to be unusual or one-time-only actions.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 157 | bei Position 2270-2271 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:28:10

Self-control turned out to be most effective when people used it to establish good habits and break bad ones.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 158 | bei Position 2272-2274 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 00:28:26

It took willpower to establish patterns of healthy behavior—which was why the people with more willpower were better able to do it—but once the habits were established, life could proceed smoothly, particularly some aspects of life.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 158 | bei Position 2274-2275 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 23:50:13

==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 161 | bei Position 2322-2325 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 28. April 2022 23:58:26

he was smart during his journey to fixate on a “stay” and a “beacon” far removed from his grim surroundings. It was a more elaborate version of the successful strategy used by the children in the classic marshmallow experiment. ==========

alcohol doesn’t increase your impulse to do stupid or destructive things; instead, it simply removes restraints. It lessens self-control in two ways: by lowering blood glucose and by reducing self-awareness. Therefore, it mainly affects behaviors marked by inner conflict,
==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 169 | bei Position 2428-2430 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. April 2022 00:11:47

alcohol doesn’t increase your impulse to do stupid or destructive things; instead, it simply removes restraints. Therefore, it mainly affects behaviors marked by inner conflict, as when part of you wants to do something and part of you does not,

The Mystery of AA
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 173 | bei Position 2496-2498 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. April 2022 23:21:27

Even if researchers haven’t figured out exactly what it does, we can point to some familiar ways in which AA appears to help. We know that self-control starts with setting standards or goals, and we can see that AA helps people set a clear and attainable goal: Do not have a drink today.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 173 | bei Position 2498-2499 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. April 2022 23:21:44

Self-control depends on monitoring, and AA offers help there, too.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 173 | bei Position 2499-2501 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. April 2022 23:22:08

Members get chips for remaining sober for certain numbers of consecutive days, and when they get up to speak, they often start by saying how many days they have been sober. Members also choose a sponsor, with whom they are supposed to remain in regular, even daily, contact—and that, too, is a powerful boost for monitoring.
==========
Willpower (Baumeister, Roy F.)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 173 | bei Position 2502-2504 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. April 2022 23:23:01

The less-inspiring explanation is “warehousing,” to borrow a term used by some skeptical sociologists to explain what high school does. They see school as a kind of warehouse that stores kids during the day, keeping them out of trouble, so that its benefits come less from what happens in the classroom than from <Sie haben die maximale Anzahl an Clipboard-Einträgen für diesen Inhalt erreicht>
==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 173 | bei Position 2501-2502 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. April 2022 23:23:07

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 8 | bei Position 161-163 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:49:36

I’m using the term formula in the same way that computer scientists talk about algorithms, as a sequence of steps that anyone can follow to get consistent results.

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 10 | bei Position 178-180 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:51:29

Personality doesn’t scale. Biology, on the other hand, scales. It is the very thing designed by evolution to work for everyone. And this tells us something important about decoding the impossible: if we can get below the level of personality, beneath the squishy and often subjective psychology of peak performance, and decode the foundational neurobiology, then we unearth mechanism.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 10 | bei Position 182-183 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:51:43

What’s the biological formula for the impossible? The answer is flow. Flow is defined as “an optimal state of consciousness where we feel our best and perform our best.”
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 10 | bei Position 188-189 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:52:24

Flow’s impact on both our physical and our mental abilities is considerable.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 10 | bei Position 191-193 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:53:25

Yet the bigger impacts are cognitive. Motivation and productivity, creativity and innovation, learning and memory, empathy and environmental awareness, and cooperation and collaboration all skyrocket—in some studies as high as 500 percent above baseline.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 11 | bei Position 197-200 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:54:01

This is what explains the skills that flow amplifies. This wide variety turns out to be everything you need to fight, flee, explore, or innovate. And since impossible is a form of extreme innovation, this explains why the state is always present when the impossible becomes possible. It’s tautological. Flow is to extreme innovation what oxygen is to breathing—simply the biology of how it gets done.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)

The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 11 | bei Position 201-204 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:54:32

when it comes to tackling the impossible, flow is necessary but not sufficient. ==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 12 | bei Position 207-209 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:55:43

For these reasons and more, we’re going to spend the rest of this book exploring a quartet of cognitive abilities—motivation, learning, creativity, and flow.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 12 | bei Position 212-218 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:56:22

The philosopher James Carse uses the terms “finite games” and “infinite games” to describe the main ways we live and play here on Earth.12 A finite game is just that—finite. It has a finite number of options and players, clearly defined winners and losers, and an established set of rules. This is chess or checkers, for sure, but it’s also politics, sports, and war. Infinite games are the opposite. They have no clear winners or losers, no established time frame for play, and no fixed rules. In infinite games, the field of play is mutable, the number of participants keeps changing, and the only goal is to keep on playing. Art, science, and love are infinite games. Most important: so is peak performance.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 12 | bei Position 220-220 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:56:42

Peak performance is an unusual kind of infinite game. It may be unwinnable, but you can definitely lose.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 13 | bei Position 225-227 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:57:24

James’s point is that the reason we’re not living up to our potential is that we’re not in the habit of living up to our potential. We’ve automatized the wrong processes. We’re playing the wrong game. And it’s bad.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 13 | bei Position 232-233 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:58:19

You get one shot at this life, and you’re going to spend one-third of it asleep. So what do you choose to do with the remaining two-thirds? That is the only question that matters.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 13 | bei Position 234-235 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:58:55

It means you lose by not trying to play full out, by not trying to do the impossible—whatever that is for you.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 14 | bei Position 241-247 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:59:32

Motivation is what gets you into this game; learning is what helps you continue to play; creativity is how you steer; and flow is how you turbo-boost the results beyond all rational standards and reasonable expectations. That, my friends, is the real art of impossible. Welcome to the infinite game. Part I Motivation If this life not be a real fight, in which something is eternally gained for the universe by success, it is no better than a game of private theatrics from which one may withdraw at will.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 14 | bei Position 240-242 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 00:59:41

This is another reason why peak performance is an infinite game. But it’s also why the quartet of skills at the heart of this book matters so much. Motivation is what gets you into this game; learning is what helps you continue to play; creativity is how you steer; and flow is how you turbo-boost the results beyond all rational standards and reasonable expectations.

Part I Motivation
==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 16 | bei Position 251-252 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 01:00:20

1 Motivation Decoded
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 260-262 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 01:01:15

motivation, as psychologists use the term, is actually a catch-all for three subsets of skills: drive, grit, and goals. Drive, the subject of the next two chapters, refers to powerful emotional motivators such as curiosity, passion, and purpose. These are feelings that drive behavior automatically.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 266-267 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 01:01:55

Goals, the topic of chapter 4, are about figuring out exactly where we’re actually trying to go.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 269-271 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 01:02:16

Grit, the subject of chapter 5, is what most people think of when they think of motivation. It’s persistence, determination, and fortitude—the ability to continue with the journey no matter the difficulty involved.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 272-273 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 15. Juli 2022 01:02:28

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 19 | bei Position 277-278 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:45:21

cultivate and align drivers such as curiosity, passion, and purpose. By stacking these sources of mental energy, they ensure on-demand access to all of life’s most potent emotional fuels.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 19 | bei Position 281-282 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:47:14

So what drives us? One way to think about this question is from an evolutionary perspective. We know that scarcity drives evolution.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 19 | bei Position 281-284 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:47:18

So what drives us? One way to think about this question is from an evolutionary perspective. We know that scarcity drives evolution. Any problem regularly encountered on a quest to gather resources is a problem that evolution already spent millions of years driving us to solve.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 19 | bei Position 288-289 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:47:43

only two strategies are available. Either you fight over dwindling resources, or you get creative and make more resources.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 19 | bei Position 289-291 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:48:15

when we talk about drive from an evolutionary perspective, what we’re really talking about are the psychological fuels that energize behaviors that best solve resource scarcity: fight/flee and explore/innovate.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 20 | bei Position 294-295 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:48:51

Goals drive us because they tell us what resources we’re trying to find on the other side of that ocean and the reason we’re trying to find them.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 20 | bei Position 295-296 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:49:09

scientists split our psychological drivers into two categories: extrinsic and intrinsic.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 20 | bei Position 296-297 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:49:14

Extrinsic drivers are rewards that are external to ourselves.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 20 | bei Position 300-303 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:49:52

Intrinsic drivers are the opposite. These are psychological and emotional forces such as curiosity, passion, meaning, and purpose. The pleasure of mastery, which we feel as the sensation of a job well done, is another potent example. Autonomy, the desire to be in charge of one’s own life, is yet another.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 305-305 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:50:18

there’s a motivational hierarchy at work.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 305-306 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:50:28

External drivers are fantastic, but only until we feel safe and secure—meaning that we have enough money to pay for food, clothing, and shelter and have a little left over for fun.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 305-307 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:50:34

External drivers are fantastic, but only until we feel safe and secure—meaning that we have enough money to pay for food, clothing, and shelter and have a little left over for fun. In US dollars and today’s economy, the research shows that this is somewhere around $75,000 a year.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 308-309 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:50:46

Measure happiness levels among Americans, as Nobel laureate Daniel Kahneman discovered, and they rise in direct proportion to income, but only until we earn about $75,000 a year.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 311-315 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:51:51

Once people feel fairly compensated for their time—meaning once that number starts to creep over $75,000 a year—big raises and annual bonuses won’t actually improve their productivity or performance. After that basic-needs line is crossed, employees want intrinsic rewards. They want to be in control of their own time (autonomy), they want to work on projects that interest them (curiosity/passion), and they want to work on projects that matter (meaning and purpose).
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 317-319 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:54:14

As high-minded as something like “meaning and purpose” might seem as a driver, this is actually evolution’s way of saying: Okay, you’ve got enough resources for yourself and your family. Now it’s time to help your tribe or your species get more.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 21 | bei Position 319-321 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 30. Juli 2022 17:54:27

Intrinsic drivers, extrinsic drivers, it doesn’t matter. In the end, like so much of life, it all comes down to neurochemistry.

Yet, when we talk about drive—the psychological energy that pushes us forward—we’re really talking about the two final systems: play/social engagement and seeking/desire.

When we play, the brain releases dopamine and oxytocin, two of our most crucial “reward chemicals.” These are pleasure drugs that make us feel good when we accomplish, or try to accomplish, anything that fulfills a basic survival need.
==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 355-357 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 21:47:28

Dopamine is the brain’s primary reward chemical, with oxytocin a close second.11 Yet serotonin, endorphins, norepinephrine, and anandamide also play a role.

Flow may be the biggest neurochemical cocktail of all. The state appears to blend all six of the brain’s major pleasure chemicals and may be one of the few times you get all six at once. This potent mix explains why people describe flow as their “favorite experience,” while psychologists refer to it as “the source code of intrinsic motivation.”

THE RECIPE FOR DRIVE
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 26 | bei Position 397-400 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 21:57:02

Over the next two chapters, we’re going to learn to stack—that is, cultivate, align, amplify, and deploy—our five most potent intrinsic drivers: curiosity, passion, purpose (chapter 2), autonomy, and mastery (chapter 3). We’re focusing on this stack of five both because they’re our most powerful drivers and because they’re neurobiologically designed to work together.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 400-410 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 21:58:05

Curiosity is where we’ll begin because that’s where the biology is designed to begin.17 This is your basic interest in something, neurochemically underpinned by a little bit of norepinephrine and dopamine. And while curiosity alone is a potent driver, it’s also a foundational ingredient in passion, which is an even bigger driver. Thus, we’ll next learn to turn that flicker of curiosity into the flame of passion by adding a lot more neurochemical fuel—norepinephrine and dopamine—to our intrinsic fire. Next comes meaning and purpose, which require connecting our individual passion to a cause much greater than ourselves. Once this happens, we see oxytocin added to the equation and an even bigger increase in core performance traits such as focus, productivity, and resilience, and our intrinsic fire burns that much hotter.18 Finally, once you have a purpose, you need to layer on the two remaining intrinsic drivers: autonomy and mastery. More specifically, once you have a purpose, the system demands autonomy, which is the freedom to pursue that purpose. Then the system requires mastery, which is the desire to continually improve the skills needed to pursue that purpose.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 410-413 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 21:58:55

interesting, full of possibility, and thick with meaning. This uptick in energy is one of the reasons why stalking the impossible might be easier than you originally suspected: With intrinsic drivers properly stacked, our biology is working for us rather than against us. In short, the act of stalking the impossible actually helps us to stalk the impossible.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 410-413 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 21:59:00

As you can see, it’s a tightly aligned stack. But built correctly, life will feel exciting, interesting, full of possibility, and thick with meaning. This uptick in energy is one of the reasons why stalking the impossible might be easier than you originally suspected: With intrinsic drivers properly stacked, our biology is working for us rather than against us. In short, the act of stalking the impossible actually helps us to stalk the impossible.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 28 | bei Position 415-416 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 21:59:08

==========

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 30 | bei Position 435-437 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:03:49

curiosity, by itself, is not enough to create true passion. There’s just not enough neurochemistry being produced for the motivation you require. The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 438-441 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:04:23

When multiple curiosity streams intersect, you not only amp up engagement—you create the necessary conditions for pattern recognition, or the linking of new ideas together.2 Pattern recognition is what the brain does at a very basic level. It’s essentially the fundamental job of most neurons. As a result, whenever we recognize a pattern, the brain rewards us with a tiny squirt of dopamine.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 442-442 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:05:04

dopamine is a powerful focusing drug.

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 444-445 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:05:47

dopamine tunes signal-to-noise ratios in the brain, which means the neurochemical increases signal, decreases noise, and, as a result, helps us detect more patterns.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 445-446 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:05:56

There’s a feedback loop here. We get dopamine when we first detect a link between two ideas (a pattern), and the dopamine that we get helps us detect even more links (pattern recognition).
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 31 | bei Position 449-450 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:06:24

dopamine is one of those aforementioned reward chemicals, a feel-good drug produced by the brain to drive behavior.

The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 454-455 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:06:55

dopamine, like all neurochemicals, amplifies memory.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 455-458 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:07:17

A quick shorthand for how learning works in the brain: the more neurochemicals that show up during an experience, the more likely that experience will move from short-term holding into long-term storage. Memory enhancement is another key role played by neurochemicals: they tag experiences as “Important, save for later.”
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 458-458 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:07:28

==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 459-461 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:07:51

Also, because dopamine provides a host of additional cognitive benefits—amplified focus, better learning, faster pattern recognition—you’ll also work smarter.

PLAY IN THE INTERSECTIONS
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 32 | bei Position 462-464 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:09:36

Now that you’ve identified the spots where curiosities overlap, play in those intersections for a little while. Devote twenty to thirty minutes a day to listening to podcasts, watching videos, reading articles, books, whatever, on any aspect of that overlap.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 469-469 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:10:05

The goal is to feed those curiosities a little bit at a time, and feed them on a daily basis.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 469-471 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:10:30

The goal is to feed those curiosities a little bit at a time, and feed them on a daily basis. This slow-growth strategy takes advantage of the brain’s inherent learning software.6 When you advance your knowledge a little bit at a time, you’re giving your adaptive unconscious a chance to process that information.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 469-473 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:10:43

The goal is to feed those curiosities a little bit at a time, and feed them on a daily basis. This slow-growth strategy takes advantage of the brain’s inherent learning software.6 When you advance your knowledge a little bit at a time, you’re giving your adaptive unconscious a chance to process that information. In the study of creativity, this process is known as “incubation.”7 What’s actually happening is pattern recognition. Automatically, the brain begins looking for connections between older bits of info you’ve already learned and the newer bits you’re currently learning.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 469-474 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:10:47

The goal is to feed those curiosities a little bit at a time, and feed them on a daily basis. This slow-growth strategy takes advantage of the brain’s inherent learning software.6 When you advance your knowledge a little bit at a time, you’re giving your adaptive unconscious a chance to process that information. In the study of creativity, this process is known as “incubation.”7 What’s actually happening is pattern recognition. Automatically, the brain begins looking for connections between older bits of info you’ve already learned and the newer bits you’re currently learning. Over time, this means more patterns, more dopamine, more motivation, and, eventually, a bit of expertise.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 475-475 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:10:53

And it’s expertise that arrives with less work.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 475-479 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:12:02

When we play with information we’re curious about, we’re not forcing the brain to make new discoveries. There’s no pressure, which is helpful, since too much stress lessens our ability to learn.9 Instead, we’re seeing what connections our brains naturally make, via the incubation phase, then allowing our biology to do the hard work for us. We’re letting our pattern recognition system find connections between curiosities that make us even more curious—which is how you cultivate passion.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 479-481 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 2. August 2022 22:12:14

Yet to increase your chances of making those connections, pay attention to two sets of details: both the history of the subject and the technical language used to describe that subject.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 481-481 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 28. August 2022 23:22:16

History is a narrative. Every subject is a voyage of curiosity. Someone had a question, someone answered
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 481-481 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 28. August 2022 23:22:24

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 651-652 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 3. September 2022 23:26:13

the freedom to surf, provides two additional benefits. First, it prioritizes exercise; second, it amplifies flow.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 653-654 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 3. September 2022 23:26:26

==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 655-657 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 3. September 2022 23:26:50

exercise doesn’t just reduce the level of stress hormones in our system, it replaces them with mood boosters like endorphins and anandamide.12 The calm optimism that results is critical for long-term peak performance.

- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 658-659 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 3. September 2022 23:27:11

sport has a high likelihood of driving participants into flow. The added push in feel-good neurochemistry the state provides is the real turbo-boost.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)
- Ihre Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 660-665 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 3. September 2022 23:28:12

To get the boost in drive that autonomy provides, you need the freedom to control your sleep, work, and exercise schedule. You also need the autonomy to chase flow via an activity of your own choosing on a regular basis. Ideally, your work time will be devoted to activities that further your purpose, and the flow-producing activity is similar to surfing—meaning it’s actually a break from work. If this isn’t possible in your life today, start with the 3M plan: devote 15 percent of your time to a project that aligns with your core passion and purpose. Fifteen percent is about an afternoon a week, though you can easily split this into a pair of two-and-a-half-hour blocks and get similar results.
==========
The Art of Impossible (Kotler, Steven)

==========
