CREATE A SUBTLE EPIPHANY
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 1651-1652 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 10. November 2022 23:31:05

One crucial aspect of any negotiation is to figure out how your adversary arrived at his position.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 1691-1694 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 10. November 2022 23:37:27

Before you convince them to see what you’re trying to accomplish, you have to say the things to them that will get them to say, “That’s right.” The “that’s right” breakthrough usually doesn’t come at the beginning of a negotiation. It’s invisible to the counterpart when it occurs, and they embrace what you’ve said. To them, it’s a subtle epiphany.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 1694-1694 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 10. November 2022 23:37:31

TRIGGER A “THAT’S RIGHT!” WITH A SUMMARY
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 103 | bei Position 1715-1716 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 10. November 2022 23:40:20

A good summary is the combination of rearticulating the meaning of what is said plus the acknowledgment of the emotions underlying that meaning (paraphrasing + labeling = summary).
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1735-1736 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 10. November 2022 23:42:48

“That’s right” signaled that negotiations could proceed from deadlock. It broke down a barrier that was impeding progress.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1738-1739 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 10. November 2022 23:43:09

When your adversaries say, “That’s right,” they feel they have assessed what you’ve said and pronounced it as correct of their own free will. They embrace it.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1742-1743 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 13. November 2022 23:57:30

“THAT’S RIGHT” IS GREAT, BUT IF “YOU’RE RIGHT,” NOTHING CHANGES
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1744-1744 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 13. November 2022 23:57:41

hearing “you’re right” is a disaster.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 106 | bei Position 1757-1759 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 13. November 2022 23:59:27

Tell people “you’re right” and they get a happy smile on their face and leave you alone for at least twenty-four hours. But you haven’t agreed to their position. You have used “you’re right” to get them to quit bothering you.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 107 | bei Position 1767-1768 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 00:00:25

USING “THAT’S RIGHT” TO MAKE THE SALE
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 111 | bei Position 1835-1835 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 00:07:47

KEY LESSONS
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1839-1841 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 00:08:44

the conversational niceties—the socially lubricating “yeses” and “you’re rights” that get thrown out fast and furious early in any interaction—are not in any way a substitute for real understanding between you and your partner. The power of getting to that understanding, and not to some simple “yes,” is revelatory in the art of negotiation.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1839-1843 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 00:09:00

the conversational niceties—the socially lubricating “yeses” and “you’re rights” that get thrown out fast and furious early in any interaction—are not in any way a substitute for real understanding between you and your partner. The power of getting to that understanding, and not to some simple “yes,” is revelatory in the art of negotiation. The moment you’ve convinced someone that you truly understand her dreams and feelings (the whole world that she inhabits), mental and behavioral change becomes possible, and the foundation for a breakthrough has been laid.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1844-1850 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 00:09:53

Creating unconditional positive regard opens the door to changing thoughts and behaviors. Humans have an innate urge toward socially constructive behavior. The more a person feels understood, and positively affirmed in that understanding, the more likely that urge for constructive behavior will take hold. ■​“That’s right” is better than “yes.” Strive for it. Reaching “that’s right” in a negotiation creates breakthroughs. ■​Use a summary to trigger a “that’s right.” The building blocks of a good summary are a label combined with paraphrasing. Identify, rearticulate, and emotionally affirm “the world according to .
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1852-1853 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 00:09:58

CHAPTER 6 BEND THEIR REALITY
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1873-1874 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:43:25

There’s always leverage. Negotiation is never a linear formula: add X to Y to get Z. We all have irrational blind spots, hidden needs, and undeveloped notions.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 115 | bei Position 1878-1879 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:44:00

DON’T COMPROMISE
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 115 | bei Position 1882-1884 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:44:41

The win-win mindset pushed by so many negotiation experts is usually ineffective and often disastrous. At best, it satisfies neither side. And if you employ it with a counterpart who has a win-lose approach, you’re setting yourself up to be swindled.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 115 | bei Position 1886-1887 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:45:26

Compromise is often a “bad deal” and a key theme we’ll hit in this chapter is that “no deal is better than a bad deal.”
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 116 | bei Position 1894-1895 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:46:22

The real problem with compromise is that it has come to be known as this great concept, in relationships and politics and everything else. Compromise, we are told quite simply, is a sacred moral good.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 116 | bei Position 1898-1901 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:47:10

We don’t compromise because it’s right; we compromise because it is easy and because it saves face. We compromise in order to say that at least we got half the pie. Distilled to its essence, we compromise to be safe. Most people in a negotiation are driven by fear or by the desire to avoid pain. Too few are driven by their actual goals. So don’t settle and—here’s a simple rule—never split the difference.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 116 | bei Position 1897-1901 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:47:16

I’m here to call bullshit on compromise right now. We don’t compromise because it’s right; we compromise because it is easy and because it saves face. We compromise in order to say that at least we got half the pie. Distilled to its essence, we compromise to be safe. Most people in a negotiation are driven by fear or by the desire to avoid pain. Too few are driven by their actual goals. So don’t settle and—here’s a simple rule—never split the difference.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 116 | bei Position 1903-1904 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:47:33

DEADLINES: MAKE TIME YOUR ALLY
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 117 | bei Position 1907-1909 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:48:31

Deadlines regularly make people say and do impulsive things that are against their best interests, because we all have a natural tendency to rush as a deadline approaches. What good negotiators do is force themselves to resist this urge and take advantage of it in others.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 117 | bei Position 1916-1918 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:49:33

Deadlines are often arbitrary, almost always flexible, and hardly ever trigger the consequences we think—or are told—they will.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 117 | bei Position 1919-1921 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:50:12

“No deal is better than a bad deal.” If that mantra can truly be internalized, and clients begin to believe they’ve got all the time they need to conduct the negotiation right, their patience becomes a formidable weapon. A
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 117 | bei Position 1919-1921 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:50:18

“No deal is better than a bad deal.” If that mantra can truly be internalized, and clients begin to believe they’ve got all the time they need to conduct the negotiation right, their patience becomes a formidable weapon.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 118 | bei Position 1931-1933 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:52:15

Increasing specificity on threats in any type of negotiations indicates getting closer to real consequences at a real specified time. To gauge the level of a particular threat, we’d pay attention to how many of the four questions—What? Who? When? And how?—were addressed.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 119 | bei Position 1951-1951 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:54:34

Deadlines cut both ways.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 119 | bei Position 1953-1954 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:54:39

When the negotiation is over for one side, it’s over for the other too.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1954-1955 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:54:50

hiding a deadline actually puts the negotiator in the worst possible position.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1955-1957 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:55:14

that hiding your deadlines dramatically increases the risk of an impasse. That’s because having a deadline pushes you to speed up your concessions, but the other side, thinking that it has time, will just hold out for more.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1960-1960 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:56:18

when negotiators tell their counterparts about their deadline, they get better deals.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1960-1962 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:56:32

First, by revealing your cutoff you reduce the risk of impasse. And second, when an opponent knows your deadline, he’ll get to the real deal- and concession-making more quickly.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1962-1964 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:56:55

Deadlines are almost never ironclad. What’s more important is engaging in the process and having a feel for how long that will take. You may see that you have more to accomplish than time will actually allow before the clock runs out.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 120 | bei Position 1964-1965 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 14. November 2022 23:56:59

NO SUCH THING AS FAIR
==========

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 121 | bei Position 1977-1979 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 15. November 2022 23:31:00

“If you approach a negotiation thinking that the other guy thinks like you, you’re wrong,” I say. “That’s not empathy; that’s projection.”
==========

We’re all irrational, all emotional. Emotion is a necessary element to decision making that we ignore at our own peril.

THE F-WORD: WHY IT’S SO POWERFUL, WHEN TO USE IT, AND HOW
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 122 | bei Position 1990-1991 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 15. November 2022 23:32:36

The most powerful word in negotiations is “Fair.”
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 122 | bei Position 1991-1992 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 15. November 2022 23:33:07

People comply with agreements if they feel they’ve been treated fairly and lash out if they don’t.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 122 | bei Position 1990-1992 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 15. November 2022 23:33:13

The most powerful word in negotiations is “Fair.” As human beings, we’re mightily swayed by how much we feel we have been respected. People comply with agreements if they feel they’ve been treated fairly and lash out if they don’t.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 124 | bei Position 2017-2018 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 15. November 2022 23:36:29

rejecting perceived unfairness, even at substantial cost, is a powerful motivation.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 124 | bei Position 2018-2020 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 15. November 2022 23:37:10

Once you understand what a messy, emotional, and destructive dynamic “fairness” can be, you can see why “Fair” is a tremendously powerful word that you need to use with care. In fact, of the three ways that people drop this F-bomb, only one is positive.
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 124 | bei Position 2020-2022 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 15. November 2022 23:37:27

The most common use is a judo-like defensive move that destabilizes the other side. This manipulation usually takes the form of something like, “We just want what’s fair.”
==========
Never Split the Difference (Voss, Chris)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 124 | bei Position 2022-2024 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 15. November 2022 23:37:52

this implicit accusation of unfairness to you, and I bet you’ll have to admit that it immediately triggered feelings of defensiveness and discomfort.  <Du hast die maximale Anzahl an Clipboard-Einträgen für diesen Inhalt erreicht>
==========

So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 6 | bei Position 231-233 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 15. Dezember 2022 23:15:30

There is, however, a problem lurking here: When you look past the feel-good slogans and go deeper into the details of how passionate people like Steve Jobs really got started, or ask scientists about what actually predicts workplace happiness, the issue becomes much more complicated. Self-Determination Theory (SDT),
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 372-373 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 20. Dezember 2022 00:25:52

Self-Determination Theory (SDT), which is arguably the best understanding science currently has for why some pursuits get our engines running while others leave us cold.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 18 | bei Position 374-379 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 20. Dezember 2022 00:25:57

SDT tells us that motivation, in the workplace or elsewhere, requires that you fulfill three basic psychological needs—factors described as the “nutriments” required to feel intrinsically motivated for your work: Autonomy: the feeling that you have control over your day, and that your actions are important Competence: the feeling that you are good at what you do Relatedness: the feeling of connection to other people
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)

THE CAREER CAPITAL THEORY OF GREAT WORK
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 695-699 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 15:57:51

The traits that define great work are rare and valuable. Supply and demand says that if you want these traits you need rare and valuable skills to offer in return. Think of these rare and valuable skills you can offer as your career capital. The craftsman mindset, with its relentless focus on becoming “so good they can’t ignore you,” is a strategy well suited for acquiring career capital. This is why it trumps the passion mindset if your goal is to create work you love.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 701-702 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 15:58:24

The traits that define great work require that you have something rare and valuable to offer in return—skills I call career capital.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 701-704 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 15:58:33

The traits that define great work require that you have something rare and valuable to offer in return—skills I call career capital. The craftsman mindset, with its relentless focus on what you produce, is exactly the mindset you would adopt if your goal was to acquire as much career capital as possible.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 48 | bei Position 701-704 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 15:58:37

The traits that define great work require that you have something rare and valuable to offer in return—skills I call career capital. The craftsman mindset, with its relentless focus on what you produce, is exactly the mindset you would adopt if your goal was to acquire as much career capital as possible. Ultimately, this is why I promote the craftsman mindset over the passion mindset.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 707-708 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 15:59:06

The passion mindset is not just ineffective for creating work you love; in many cases it can actively work against this goal, sometimes with devastating consequences.
==========

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 49 | bei Position 705-706 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 15:59:18

You need to get good in order to get good things in your working life, and the craftsman mindset is focused on achieving exactly this goal.

From Courage to Food Stamps
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 51 | bei Position 729-732 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 16:01:55

courage culture, a growing community of authors and online commentators pushing the following idea: The biggest obstacle between you and work you love is a lack of courage—the courage required to step away from “other people’s definition of success” and to follow your dream.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 51 | bei Position 729-733 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 16:02:05

courage culture, a growing community of authors and online commentators pushing the following idea: The biggest obstacle between you and work you love is a lack of courage—the courage required to step away from “other people’s definition of success” and to follow your dream. It’s an idea that makes perfect sense when presented against the backdrop of the passion mindset: If there’s some perfect job waiting for us out there, every day we’re not following this passion is a wasted day.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 51 | bei Position 736-738 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 16:04:31

The downside of the passion mindset is that it strips away merit. For passion proponents like Slim, launching a freelance career that gives you control, creativity, and impact is easy—it’s just the act of getting started that trips us up. Career capital theory disagrees. It tells us that great work doesn’t just require great courage, but also skills of great (and real) value.
==========

So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 55 | bei Position 784-786 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 16:33:32

Part of what makes the craftsman mindset thrilling is its agnosticism toward the type of work you do. The traits that define great work are bought with career capital, the theory argues; they don’t come from matching your work to your innate passion.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 55 | bei Position 784-787 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 16:33:44

Part of what makes the craftsman mindset thrilling is its agnosticism toward the type of work you do. The traits that define great work are bought with career capital, the theory argues; they don’t come from matching your work to your innate passion. Because of this, you don’t have to sweat whether you’ve found your calling—most any work can become the foundation for a compelling career.
==========

THREE DISQUALIFIERS FOR APPLYING THE CRAFTSMAN MINDSET
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 56 | bei Position 795-797 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 16:35:21

The job presents few opportunities to distinguish yourself by developing relevant skills that are rare and valuable. The job focuses on something you think is useless or perhaps even actively bad for the world. The job forces you to work with people you really dislike.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 57 | bei Position 798-800 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 22. Dezember 2022 16:36:36

A job with any combination of these disqualifying traits can thwart your attempts to build and invest career capital. If it satisfies the first trait, skill growth isn’t possible. If it satisfies the second two traits, then even though you could build up reserves of career capital, you’ll have a hard time sticking around long enough to accomplish this goal.
==========

The 10,000-Hour Rule
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 80 | bei Position 1065-1067 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 21:58:07

The idea that excellence at performing a complex task requires a critical minimum level of practice surfaces again and again in studies of expertise. In fact, researchers have settled on what they believe is the magic number for true expertise: ten thousand hours
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 81 | bei Position 1073-1074 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:02:20

What interests me about Charness’s study, however, is that it moves beyond the 10,000-hour rule by asking not just how long people worked, but also what type of work they did.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 82 | bei Position 1082-1082 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:03:51

Hours spent in serious study of the game was not just the most important factor in predicting chess skill, it dominated the other factors.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 82 | bei Position 1086-1087 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:04:06

In serious study, Charness concluded, “materials can be deliberately chosen or adapted such that the problems to be solved are at a level that is appropriately challenging.”
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 82 | bei Position 1089-1090 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:04:43

Furthermore, in serious study, feedback is immediate: be it from looking up the answer to a chess problem in a book or, as is more typically the case for serious players, receiving immediate feedback from an expert coach.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 83 | bei Position 1093-1094 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:05:13

focused on difficult activities, carefully chosen to stretch your abilities where they most need stretching and that provide immediate feedback.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 83 | bei Position 1098-1100 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:05:59

In the early 1990s, Anders Ericsson, a colleague of Neil Charness at Florida State University, coined the term “deliberate practice” to describe this style of serious study, defining it formally as an “activity designed, typically by a teacher, for the sole purpose of effectively improving specific aspects of an individual’s performance.”
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 83 | bei Position 1101-1101 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:06:12

deliberate practice provides the key to excellence in a diverse array of fields,
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 84 | bei Position 1107-1112 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:07:15

“When experts exhibit their superior performance in public their behavior looks so effortless and natural that we are tempted to attribute it to special talents,” Ericsson notes. “However, when scientists began measuring the experts’ supposedly superior powers … no general superiority was found.”6 In other words, outside a handful of extreme examples—such as the height of professional basketball players and the girth of football linemen—scientists have failed to find much evidence of natural abilities explaining experts’ successes.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 84 | bei Position 1107-1113 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:07:27

“When experts exhibit their superior performance in public their behavior looks so effortless and natural that we are tempted to attribute it to special talents,” Ericsson notes. “However, when scientists began measuring the experts’ supposedly superior powers … no general superiority was found.”6 In other words, outside a handful of extreme examples—such as the height of professional basketball players and the girth of football linemen—scientists have failed to find much evidence of natural abilities explaining experts’ successes. It is a lifetime accumulation of deliberate practice that again and again ends up explaining excellence.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 84 | bei Position 1113-1115 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:07:46

Here’s what struck me as important about deliberate practice: It’s not obvious. Outside of fields such as chess, music, and professional athletics, which have clear competitive structures and training regimes, few participate in anything that even remotely approximates this style of skill development.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 85 | bei Position 1117-1118 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:09:03

if you just show up and work hard, you’ll soon hit a performance plateau beyond which you fail to get any better.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 85 | bei Position 1121-1125 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 23. Dezember 2022 22:09:46

in most types of work—that is, work that doesn’t have a clear training philosophy—most people are stuck. This generates an exciting implication. Let’s assume you’re a knowledge worker, which is a field without a clear training philosophy. If you can figure out how to integrate deliberate practice into your own life, you have the possibility of blowing past your peers in your value, as you’ll likely be alone in your dedication to systematically getting better. That is, deliberate practice might provide the key to quickly becoming so good they can’t ignore you.
==========

Step 1: Decide What Capital Market You’re In
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 91 | bei Position 1197-1198 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:45:55

When you are acquiring career capital in a field, you can imagine that you are acquiring this capital in a specific type of career capital market. There are two types of these markets: winner-take-all and auction.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 91 | bei Position 1198-1199 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:46:05

In a winner-take-all market, there is only one type of career capital available, and lots of different people competing for it.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 92 | bei Position 1201-1202 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:46:14

An auction market, by contrast, is less structured: There are many different types of career capital, and each person might generate a unique collection.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 92 | bei Position 1204-1206 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:46:46

With this in mind, the first task in building a deliberate practice strategy is to figure out what type of career capital market you are competing in. Answering this question might seem obvious, but it’s surprisingly easy to get it wrong.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1213-1213 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:47:46

Mistaking a winner-take-all for an auction market is common. I see it often in an area relevant to my own life: blogging.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 93 | bei Position 1222-1224 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:48:48

blogging in the advice space—where his site existed—is not an auction market, it’s winner-take-all. The only capital that matters is whether or not your posts compel the reader.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1224-1226 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:49:12

Some top blogs in this space have notoriously clunky designs, but they all accomplish the same baseline goal: They inspire their readers. When you correctly understand the market where blogging exists, you stop calculating your bounce rate and start focusing instead on saying something people really care about—which is where your energy should be if you want to succeed.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 1229-1229 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:49:26

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 1237-1239 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 09:57:42

It helps to think about skill acquisition like a freight train: Getting it started requires a huge application of effort, but changing its track once it’s moving is easy.

Step 5: Be Patient
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 1283-1287 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 10:04:01

In his memoir, Martin expounds on this idea when he discusses the importance of “diligence” for his success in the entertainment business. What’s interesting is that Martin redefines the word so that it’s less about paying attention to your main pursuit, and more about your willingness to ignore other pursuits that pop up along the way to distract you. The final step for applying deliberate practice to your working life is to adopt this style of diligence.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 1287-1287 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 10:04:07

Chapter Eight The Dream-Job Elixir
==========

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 1316-1317 | Hinzugefügt am Sonntag, 25. Dezember 2022 10:07:12

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 111 | bei Position 1388-1392 | Hinzugefügt am Montag, 26. Dezember 2022 22:43:00

As I’ll argue next, control isn’t just the source of Ryan and Sarah’s appeal, but it turns out to be one of the most universally important traits that you can acquire with your career capital—something so powerful and so essential to the quest for work you love that I’ve taken to calling it the dream-job elixir.
==========

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1393-1395 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 08:23:20

Dan Pink’s 2009 bestselling book Drive,

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1403-1404 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 08:25:02

If you want to observe the power of control up close in the workplace, look toward companies embracing a radical new philosophy called Results-Only Work Environment (or, ROWE, for short).
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1403-1405 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 08:25:12

If you want to observe the power of control up close in the workplace, look toward companies embracing a radical new philosophy called Results-Only Work Environment (or, ROWE, for short). In a ROWE company, all that matters is your results. When you show up to work and when you leave, when you take vacations, and how often you check e-mail are all irrelevant.
==========

Chapter Nine The First Control Trap
==========

Chapter Ten The Second Control Trap
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 122 | bei Position 1498-1500 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 08:43:23

which warns that once you have enough career capital to acquire more control in your working life, you have become valuable enough to your employer that they will fight your efforts to gain more autonomy.

Control Generates Resistance
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 128 | bei Position 1569-1570 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 20:55:57

The more I met people who successfully deployed control in their career, the more I heard similar tales of resistance from their employers, friends, and families.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 130 | bei Position 1596-1598 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 20:59:19

This is the irony of control. When no one cares what you do with your working life, you probably don’t have enough career capital to do anything interesting. But once you do have this capital, as Lulu and Lewis discovered, you’ve become valuable enough that your employer will resist your efforts.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1599-1602 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 20:59:24

The Second Control Trap The point at which you have acquired enough career capital to get meaningful control over your working life is exactly the point when you’ve become valuable enough to your current employer that they will try to prevent you from making the change.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1605-1608 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 21:00:08

in most jobs you should expect your employer to resist your move toward more control; they have every incentive to try to convince you to reinvest your career capital back into your career at their company, obtaining more money and prestige instead of more control, and this can be a hard argument to resist.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 131 | bei Position 1608-1609 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 21:00:18

The Law of Financial Viability
==========

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 137 | bei Position 1671-1672 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 21:08:25

So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 139 | bei Position 1688-1691 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 21:11:00

The Law of Financial Viability When deciding whether to follow an appealing pursuit that will introduce more control into your work life, seek evidence of whether people are willing to pay for it. If you find this evidence, continue. If not, move on.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 139 | bei Position 1693-1694 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 21:12:02

Summary of Rule #3
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 142 | bei Position 1719-1720 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 21:15:02

gaining control over what you do and how you do it is incredibly important.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 142 | bei Position 1719-1727 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 21:15:28

gaining control over what you do and how you do it is incredibly important. This trait shows up so often in the lives of people who love what they do that I’ve taken to calling it the dream-job elixir. Investing your capital in control, however, turns out to be tricky. There are two traps that commonly snare people in their pursuit of this trait. The first control trap notes that it’s dangerous to try to gain more control without enough capital to back it up. The second control trap notes that once you have the capital to back up a bid for more control, you’re still not out of the woods. This capital makes you valuable enough to your employer that they will likely now fight to keep you on a more traditional path. They realize that gaining more control is good for you but not for their bottom line. The control traps put you in a difficult situation.
==========
So Good They Can't Ignore You (Newport, Cal)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 142 | bei Position 1719-1729 | Hinzugefügt am Dienstag, 27. Dezember 2022 21:15:39

gaining control over what you do and how you do it is incredibly important. This trait shows up so often in th <Du hast die maximale Anzahl an Clipboard-Einträgen für diesen Inhalt erreicht>

Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 2 | bei Position 60-63 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 29. Dezember 2022 22:36:58

To be able to make use of information we value, we need a way to package it up and send it through time to our future self. We need a way to cultivate a body of knowledge that is uniquely our own, so when the opportunity arises—whether changing jobs, giving a big presentation, launching a new product, or starting a business or a family—we will have access to the wisdom we need to make good decisions and take the most effective action. It all begins with the simple act of writing things down.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 3 | bei Position 67-67 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 29. Dezember 2022 22:37:35

personal knowledge management helps us harness the full potential of what we know.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 3 | bei Position 69-76 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 29. Dezember 2022 22:38:08

The Building a Second Brain system will teach you how to: Find anything you’ve learned, touched, or thought about in the past within seconds. Organize your knowledge and use it to move your projects and goals forward more consistently. Save your best thinking so you don’t have to do it again. Connect ideas and notice patterns across different areas of your life so you know how to live better. Adopt a reliable system that helps you share your work more confidently and with more ease. Turn work “off” and relax, knowing you have a trusted system keeping track of all the details. Spend less time looking for things, and more time doing the best, most creative work you are capable of.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 4 | bei Position 88-90 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 29. Dezember 2022 22:40:03

Those who learn how to leverage technology and master the flow of information through their lives will be empowered to accomplish anything they set their minds to. At the same time, those who continue to rely on their fragile biological brains will become ever more overwhelmed by the explosive growth in the complexity of our lives.
==========

Chapter 2  What Is a Second Brain?
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 17 | bei Position 232-233 | Hinzugefügt am Donnerstag, 29. Dezember 2022 22:54:33

Information is the fundamental building block of everything you do.
==========

Your professional success and quality of life depend directly on your ability to manage information effectively.

Rethinking Notetaking:
Notes as Knowledge Building Blocks
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 23 | bei Position 308-310 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:30:35

As a knowledge worker, where does your knowledge live? Where does your knowledge go when it’s created or discovered? “Knowledge” can seem like a lofty concept reserved exclusively for scholars and academics, but at the most practical level, knowledge begins with the simple, time-honored practice of taking notes.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 23 | bei Position 308-310 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:30:45

“Knowledge” can seem like a lofty concept reserved exclusively for scholars and academics, but at the most practical level, knowledge begins with the simple, time-honored practice of taking notes.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 23 | bei Position 310-313 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:31:37

You were probably first told to write something down because it would be on the test. This implied that the minute the test was over, you would never reference those notes again. Learning was treated as essentially disposable, with no intention of that knowledge being useful for the long term.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 23 | bei Position 313-319 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:32:03

The entire approach to notetaking you learned in school is not only obsolete, it’s the exact opposite of what you need. In the professional world: It’s not at all clear what you should be taking notes on. No one tells you when or how your notes will be used. The “test” can come at any time and in any form. You’re allowed to reference your notes at any time, provided you took them in the first place. You are expected to take action on your notes, not just regurgitate them.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 320-322 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:33:13

For modern, professional notetaking, a note is a “knowledge building block”—a discrete unit of information interpreted through your unique perspective and stored outside your head.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 322-324 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:36:15

a note could include a passage from a book or article that you were inspired by; a photo or image from the web with your annotations; or a bullet-point list of your meandering thoughts on a topic, among many other examples.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 324-326 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:36:38

The length and format don’t matter—if a piece of content has been interpreted through your lens, curated according to your taste, translated into your own words, or drawn from your life experience, and stored in a secure place, then it qualifies as a note.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 326-328 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:36:59

A knowledge building block is discrete. It stands on its own and has intrinsic value, but knowledge building blocks can also be combined into something much greater—a report, an argument, a proposal, a story.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 24 | bei Position 330-331 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:37:22

You need to put in the effort to create a note only once, and then you can just mix and match and try out different combinations until something clicks.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 373-374 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:42:01

dictate a quick audio memo to your phone as you drive, which gets automatically transcribed and saved in your notes.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 27 | bei Position 376-377 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:42:39

withhold judgment, seeking to gather the widest possible range of feedback before deciding on a course of action.

Chapter 3  How a Second Brain Works
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 448-449 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:47:30

Think of your Second Brain as the world’s best personal assistant.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 33 | bei Position 448-450 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:47:41

Think of your Second Brain as the world’s best personal assistant. It is perfectly reliable and totally consistent. It is always ready and waiting to capture any bit of information that might be of value to you. It follows directions, makes helpful suggestions, and reminds you of what’s important to you.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 456-460 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:48:30

The Superpowers of a Second Brain There are four essential capabilities that we can rely on a Second Brain to perform for us: Making our ideas concrete. Revealing new associations between ideas. Incubating our ideas over time. Sharpening our unique perspectives.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 461-462 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:48:34

Second Brain Superpower #1:
Make Our Ideas Concrete
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 34 | bei Position 462-464 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:49:24

Before we do anything with our ideas, we have to “off-load” them from our minds and put them into concrete form. Only when we declutter our brain of complex ideas can we think clearly and start to work with those ideas effectively.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 478-479 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:51:02

“The skills we have developed for dealing with the external world go beyond those we have for dealing with the internal world.”
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 475-477 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:51:11

Digital notes aren’t physical, but they are visual. They turn vague concepts into tangible entities that can be observed, rearranged, edited, and combined together. They may exist only in virtual form, but we can still see them with our eyes and move them around with our fingers.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 35 | bei Position 479-480 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:51:17

Reveal New Associations Between Ideas

creativity is about connecting ideas together, especially ideas that don’t seem to be connected.

mix up the order of our ideas until something unexpected emerges. The more diverse and unusual the material you put into it in the first place, the more original the connections that will emerge.

Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)

Second Brain Superpower #3:
Incubate Our Ideas Over Time
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 36 | bei Position 495-497 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:54:16

when we do a brainstorm, that still relies only on ideas that we can think up right now. What are the chances that the most creative, most innovative approaches will instantly be top of mind? What are the odds that the best way to move forward is one of the first ways we come up with?
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 36 | bei Position 495-498 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:54:25

when we do a brainstorm, that still relies only on ideas that we can think up right now. What are the chances that the most creative, most innovative approaches will instantly be top of mind? What are the odds that the best way to move forward is one of the first ways we come up with? This tendency is known as recency bias.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 36 | bei Position 495-500 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:54:34

when we do a brainstorm, that still relies only on ideas that we can think up right now. What are the chances that the most creative, most innovative approaches will instantly be top of mind? What are the odds that the best way to move forward is one of the first ways we come up with? This tendency is known as recency bias.4 We tend to favor the ideas, solutions, and influences that occurred to us most recently, regardless of whether they are the best ones.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 37 | bei Position 503-504 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 10:55:12

Having a Second Brain where lots of ideas can be permanently saved for the long term turns the passage of time into your friend, instead of your enemy.
==========

Choosing a Notetaking App:
The Neural Center of Your Second Brain
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 38 | bei Position 525-527 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 11:00:40

While your Second Brain is made up of all the tools you use to interact with information, including a to-do list, a calendar, email, and reading apps, for example, there is one category of software I recommend as the centerpiece of your Second Brain: a digital notetaking app.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 39 | bei Position 530-540 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 11:01:00

digital notes apps have four powerful characteristics that make them ideal for building a Second Brain. They are: Multimedia: Just like a paper notebook might contain drawings and sketches, quotes and ideas, and even a pasted photo or Post-it, a notes app can store a wide variety of different kinds of content in one place, so you never need to wonder where to put something. Informal: Notes are inherently messy, so there’s no need for perfect spelling or polished presentation. This makes it as easy and frictionless as possible to jot things down as soon as they occur to you, which is essential to allow nascent ideas to grow. Open-ended: Taking notes is a continuous process that never really ends, and you don’t always know where it might lead. Unlike more specialized kinds of software that are designed to produce a specific kind of output (such as slide decks, spreadsheets, graphics, or videos), notes are ideal for free-form exploration before you have a goal in mind. Action-oriented: Unlike a library or research database, personal notes don’t need to be comprehensive or precise. They are designed to help you quickly capture stray thoughts so you can remain focused on the task at hand.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 39 | bei Position 530-531 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 11:01:12

digital notes apps have four powerful characteristics that make them ideal for building a Second Brain. They are:
==========

Multimedia:
==========

Informal:

Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)

==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 39 | bei Position 540-543 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 11:04:14

All four of the above qualities are shared by paper notes, but when we make them digital, we can supercharge these timeless benefits with the incredible capabilities of technology—searching, sharing, backups, editing, linking, syncing between devices, and many others. Digital notes combine the casual artistry of a daily sketchbook with the scientific power of modern software.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)

Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 40 | bei Position 547-549 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 11:05:04

Although you will always use many different software programs to manage information and do your work—from word processors to messaging platforms and project management tools used within your organization—your notes app is uniquely designed to facilitate personal knowledge management.

It’s not about having the perfect tools—it’s about having a reliable set of tools you can depend on, knowing you can always change them later.

Remembering, Connecting, Creating: The Three Stages of Personal Knowledge Management
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 41 | bei Position 558-559 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:34:31

The first way that people tend to use their Second Brain is as a memory aid. They use their digital notes to save facts and ideas that they would have trouble recalling otherwise:
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 41 | bei Position 564-564 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:35:06

The second way that people use their Second Brain is to connect ideas together.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 41 | bei Position 564-565 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:35:15

The second way that people use their Second Brain is to connect ideas together. Their Second Brain evolves from being primarily a memory tool to becoming a thinking tool.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 42 | bei Position 571-572 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:36:02

Eventually, the third and final way that people use their Second Brain is for creating new things.

Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 42 | bei Position 571-573 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:36:11

Eventually, the third and final way that people use their Second Brain is for creating new things. They realize that they have a lot of knowledge on a subject and decide to turn it into something concrete and shareable.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 42 | bei Position 583-584 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:37:12

Introducing The CODE Method: The Four Steps to Remembering What Matters
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 42 | bei Position 584-586 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:37:31

“CODE”—Capture; Organize; Distill; Express.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)

Capture: Keep What Resonates
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 44 | bei Position 601-603 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:39:31

we can’t consume every bit of this information stream. We will quickly be exhausted and overwhelmed if we try. We need to adopt the perspective of a curator, stepping back from the raging river and starting to make intentional decisions about what information we want to fill our minds.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 44 | bei Position 601-603 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:39:34

Here’s the problem: we can’t consume every bit of this information stream. We will quickly be exhausted and overwhelmed if we try. We need to adopt the perspective of a curator, stepping back from the raging river and starting to make intentional decisions about what information we want to fill our minds.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 44 | bei Position 603-604 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:39:42

our goal should be to “capture” only the ideas and insights we think are truly noteworthy.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 44 | bei Position 609-610 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:40:20

The solution is to keep only what resonates in a trusted place that you control, and to leave the rest aside.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 45 | bei Position 612-614 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:40:51

Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)

Adopting the habit of knowledge capture has immediate benefits for our mental health and peace of mind. We can let go of the fear that our memory will fail us at a crucial moment. Instead of jumping at every new headline and notification, we can choose to consume information that adds value to our lives and consciously let go of the rest.
==========

Organize: Save for Actionability
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 45 | bei Position 620-622 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:42:13

It is tempting to try to create a perfect hierarchy of folders up front to contain every possible note you might ever want to capture. Even if it was possible, that approach would be incredibly time-consuming and require way too much effort, pulling you away from what interests you today.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 46 | bei Position 625-627 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:42:25

When it comes to digital notes, we can use much easier and lighter ways of organizing. Because our priorities and goals can change at a moment’s notice, and probably will, we want to avoid organizing methods that are overly rigid and prescriptive.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 46 | bei Position 627-629 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:42:46

The best way to organize your notes is to organize for action, according to the active projects you are working on right now. Consider new information in terms of its utility, asking, “How is this going to help me move forward one of my current projects?”
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 46 | bei Position 630-631 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:43:02

There are relatively few things that are actionable and relevant at any given time, which means you have a clear filter for ignoring everything else.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 46 | bei Position 633-634 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:43:24

Distill: Find the Essence
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 46 | bei Position 634-635 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:43:45

==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 640-641 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:44:30

There is a powerful way to facilitate and speed up this process of rapid association: distill your notes down to their essence.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 641-643 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:44:46

Every idea has an “essence”: the heart and soul of what it is trying to communicate. It might take hundreds of pages and thousands of words to fully explain a complex insight, but there is always a way to convey the core message in just a sentence or two.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 646-648 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:45:21

in the midst of a busy workday, you won’t have time to review ten pages of notes on a book you read last year—you need to be able to quickly find just the main takeaways.

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 649-650 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:45:42

==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 47 | bei Position 651-654 | Hinzugefügt am Freitag, 30. Dezember 2022 17:46:14

Your notes will be useless if you can’t decipher them in the future, or if they’re so long that you don’t even try. Think of yourself not just as a taker of notes, but as a giver of notes—you are giving your future self the gift of knowledge that is easy to find and understand.
==========

Creating a Knowledge Bank: How to Generate Compounding Interest from Your Thoughts
==========

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 57 | bei Position 768-769 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:29:03

To answer that question, we have to radically expand our definition of “knowledge.”

This includes the content you gather from outside sources but also the content you create as you compose emails, draw up project plans, brainstorm ideas, and journal your own thoughts.

These aren’t just random artifacts with no value—they are “knowledge assets” that crystallize what you know in concrete form.
==========

Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 58 | bei Position 785-786 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:32:08

Sometimes these assets are quite mundane
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 58 | bei Position 786-787 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:32:13

At other times that knowledge is lofty and grand
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 58 | bei Position 787-789 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:32:26

Or anything in between. A knowledge asset is anything that can be used in the future to solve a problem, save time, illuminate a concept, or learn from past experience.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 59 | bei Position 799-806 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:33:33

As you start collecting this material from the outer world, it often sparks new ideas and realizations in your inner world. You can capture those thoughts too! They could include: Stories: Your favorite anecdotes, whether they happened to you or someone else. Insights: The small (and big) realizations you have. Memories: Experiences from your life that you don’t want to forget. Reflections: Personal thoughts and lessons written in a journal or diary. Musings: Random “shower ideas” that pop into your head.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 58 | bei Position 789-795 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:33:44

Knowledge assets can come from either the external world or your inner thoughts. External knowledge could include: Highlights: Insightful passages from books or articles you read. Quotes: Memorable passages from podcasts or audiobooks you listen to. Bookmarks and favorites: Links to interesting content you find on the web or favorited social media posts. Voice memos: Clips recorded on your mobile device as “notes to self.” Meeting notes: Notes you take about what was discussed during meetings or phone calls. Images: Photos or other images that you find inspiring or interesting.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 60 | bei Position 806-807 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:34:50

The meaning of a thought, insight, or memory often isn’t immediately clear. We need to write them down, revisit them, and view them from a different perspective in order to digest what they mean to us.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 60 | bei Position 815-815 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:35:41

What Not to Keep
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 60 | bei Position 817-827 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:36:19

Is this sensitive information you’d like to keep secure? The content you save in your notes is easily accessible from any device, which is great for accessibility but not for security. Information like tax records, government documents, passwords, and health records shouldn’t be saved in your notes. Is this a special format or file type better handled by a dedicated app? Although you could save specialized files such as Photoshop files or video footage in your notes, you’ll need a specialized app to open them anyway, so there’s no benefit to keeping them in your notes. Is this a very large file? Notes apps are made for short, lightweight bits of text and images, and their performance will often be severely hampered if you try to save large files in them. Will it need to be collaboratively edited? Notes apps are perfectly suited for individual, private use, which makes them less than ideal for collaboration. You can share individual notes or even groups of notes with others, but if you need multiple people to be able to collaboratively edit a document in real time, then you’ll need to use a different platform.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 61 | bei Position 827-828 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:37:29

Twelve Favorite Problems: A Nobel Prize Winner’s Approach to Capturing
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 62 | bei Position 840-843 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:39:29

You have to keep a dozen of your favorite problems constantly present in your mind, although by and large they will lay in a dormant state. Every time you hear or read a new trick or a new result, test it against each of your twelve problems to see whether it helps. Every once in a while there will be a hit, and people will say, “How did he do it? He must be a genius!”
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 62 | bei Position 843-846 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:39:55

Feynman’s approach was to maintain a list of a dozen open questions. When a new scientific finding came out, he would test it against each of his questions to see if it shed any new light on the problem. This cross-disciplinary approach allowed him to make connections across seemingly unrelated subjects, while continuing to follow his sense of curiosity.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 63 | bei Position 857-858 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:43:13

Feynman’s approach encouraged him to follow his interests wherever they might lead.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 63 | bei Position 858-860 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:43:26

He posed questions and constantly scanned for solutions to long-standing problems in his reading, conversations, and everyday life. When he found one, he could make a connection that looked to others like a flash of unparalleled brilliance.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 63 | bei Position 860-860 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:43:32

Ask yourself, “What are the questions I’ve always been interested in?”
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 64 | bei Position 875-876 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:45:03

The key to this exercise is to make them open-ended questions that don’t necessarily have a single answer.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 64 | bei Position 875-877 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:45:07

The key to this exercise is to make them open-ended questions that don’t necessarily have a single answer. To find questions that invoke a state of wonder and curiosity about the amazing world we live in.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 64 | bei Position 877-879 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:45:23

The power of your favorite problems is that they tend to stay fairly consistent over time. The exact framing of each question may change, but even as we move between projects, jobs, relationships, and careers, our favorite problems tend to follow us across the years.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 65 | bei Position 879-881 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 10:45:31

I recommend asking your family or childhood friends what you were obsessed with as a kid. Those very same interests probably still fire your imagination as an adult. Which means any content you collect related to them will likely be relevant far into the future as well.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 65 | bei Position 889-895 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 12:33:57

Take a moment now to write down some of your own favorite problems. Here are my recommendations to guide you: Ask people close to you what you were obsessed with as a child (often you’ll continue to be fascinated with the same things as an adult). Don’t worry about coming up with exactly twelve (the exact number doesn’t matter, but try to come up with at least a few). Don’t worry about getting the list perfect (this is just a first pass, and it will always be evolving). Phrase them as open-ended questions that could have multiple answers (in contrast to “yes/no” questions with only one answer).
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 895-897 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 12:34:29

Use your list of favorite problems to make decisions about what to capture: anything potentially relevant to answering them. Use one of the capture tools I recommend later in this chapter, or in the Second Brain Resource Guide at Buildingasecondbrain.com/resources
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 895-896 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 12:35:26

Use your list of favorite problems to make decisions about what to capture: anything potentially relevant to answering them.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 66 | bei Position 897-898 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 12:35:34

- Deine Markierung auf Seite 68 | bei Position 922-923 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 12:38:25

Here are four criteria I suggest to help you decide exactly which nuggets of knowledge are worth keeping: Capture Criteria #1: Does It Inspire Me?
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 68 | bei Position 925-926 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 12:39:19

There is a way to evoke a sense of inspiration more regularly: keep a collection of inspiring quotes, photos, ideas, and stories.
==========
Building a Second Brain (Forte, Tiago)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 68 | bei Position 925-927 | Hinzugefügt am Samstag, 31. Dezember 2022 12:39:28
