Storing socks Treat your socks and tights with respect
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 94 | bei Position 858-859 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:16:13

Let me state here and now: never, ever tie up your tights and stockings. Never, ever ball your socks.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 861-862 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:16:38

The socks and tights stored in your drawer are essentially on holiday. They take a brutal beating in their daily work, trapped between your foot and your shoe, enduring pressure and friction to protect your precious feet.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 861-864 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:17:15

The socks and tights stored in your drawer are essentially on holiday. They take a brutal beating in their daily work, trapped between your foot and your shoe, enduring pressure and friction to protect your precious feet. The time they spend in your drawer is their only chance to rest. But if they are folded over, balled up or tied, they are always in a state of tension, their fabric stretched and their elastic pulled.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 866-868 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:17:28

Let’s begin with how to fold your tights. If you’ve tied them up, start by undoing the knot! Lay the toes one on top of the other and fold the tights in half lengthwise.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 866-869 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:17:47

Let’s begin with how to fold your tights. If you’ve tied them up, start by undoing the knot! Lay the toes one on top of the other and fold the tights in half lengthwise. Then fold them into thirds, making sure that the toes are inside, not outside, and that the waistband protrudes slightly at the top.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 95 | bei Position 866-871 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:18:12

Let’s begin with how to fold your tights. If you’ve tied them up, start by undoing the knot! Lay the toes one on top of the other and fold the tights in half lengthwise. Then fold them into thirds, making sure that the toes are inside, not outside, and that the waistband protrudes slightly at the top. Finally, roll the tights up toward the waistband. If the waistband is on the outside when you finish, you’ve done it right. Fold knee-high stockings the same way. With thicker material, such as winter tights, it is easier to roll if you fold them in half rather than in thirds. The point is that the tights should be firm and stable when you’ve finished, much like a sushi roll.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 96 | bei Position 871-875 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:18:41

When you store the tights in your drawer, arrange them on end so that the swirl is visible. If you are storing them in plastic drawers, I recommend putting them into a cardboard box first, so that they don’t slip and unroll, and putting the box into the drawer. A shoebox is the perfect size for a tights divider. This method is a win-win solution. It allows you to see how many pairs of tights you have at a single glance, protects them from damage, and keeps them smooth and unwrinkled so that they are easier to put on. And it makes your tights much happier, too.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 96 | bei Position 875-875 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:18:51

Folding socks is even easier.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 96 | bei Position 876-880 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:19:23

Place one sock on top of the other and follow the same principles as those for folding clothing. For low-cut socks that just cover the feet, folding twice is enough; for ankle socks, three times; for knee socks and over-knee socks, four to six times. You can adjust the number of folds to achieve the height that best suits the drawer. It’s easy. Just aim to make a simple rectangle, the key to folding. Store the socks on edge, just as you did for clothing. You’ll be amazed at how little space you need compared to your ‘potato ball days’, and you’ll notice your socks breathing a sigh of relief at being untied.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 97 | bei Position 882-883 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:19:37

Seasonal clothes No need to store off-season clothes
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 896-897 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:21:37

it’s time to abandon this custom and keep all our clothes ready to be used year-round, regardless of the season.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 99 | bei Position 898-901 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:22:17

All you need to do is organise your clothes on the premise that you aren’t going to put off-season clothes in storage. The trick is not to over-categorise. Divide your clothes roughly into ‘cotton-like’ and ‘wool-like’ materials when you put them in the drawer. Categorising by season – summer, winter, autumn and spring – or by activity, such as work and leisure, should be avoided because it is too vague.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 100 | bei Position 911-912 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:23:34

Storing books Put all of your books on the floor
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 925-928 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:27:43

Remove all the books from your bookcases. You cannot judge whether or not a book really grabs you when it’s still on the shelf. Like clothes or any other belongings, books that have been left untouched on the shelf for a long time are dormant. Or perhaps I should say they’re ‘invisible’. Although in plain sight, they remain unseen, just like a grasshopper stood still in the grass, merging with its surroundings.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 102 | bei Position 925-930 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:28:02

Remove all the books from your bookcases. You cannot judge whether or not a book really grabs you when it’s still on the shelf. Like clothes or any other belongings, books that have been left untouched on the shelf for a long time are dormant. Or perhaps I should say they’re ‘invisible’. Although in plain sight, they remain unseen, just like a grasshopper stood still in the grass, merging with its surroundings. If you ask yourself, ‘Does this spark joy?’ when you are just looking at the things on your shelves or in your drawers, the question won’t mean much to you. To truly decide whether you want to keep something or to throw it away, you must take your things out of hibernation.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 103 | bei Position 936-938 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:29:17

If there are too many books to arrange on the floor all at one time, I ask my clients to divide them into four broad categories: General (books you read for pleasure) Practical (references, cookbooks, etc.) Visual (photograph collections, etc.) Magazines
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 103 | bei Position 938-940 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:29:50

Once you have piled your books, take them in your hand one by one and decide if you want to keep or discard each one. The criterion is, of course, whether or not it gives you a thrill of pleasure when you touch it. Remember, I said when you touch it. Make sure you don’t start reading it. Reading clouds your judgment.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 104 | bei Position 943-944 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:30:07

The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 105 | bei Position 951-954 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:31:57

Books you have read have already been experienced and their content is inside you, even if you don’t remember. So when deciding which books to keep, forget about whether you think you’ll read it again or whether you’ve mastered what’s inside. Instead, take each book in your hand and decide whether it moves you or not.

The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 108 | bei Position 979-982 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:36:17

If you haven’t done what you intended to do yet, throw that book away. Only by discarding it will you be able to test how passionate you are about that subject. If your feelings don’t change after discarding it, then you’re fine as is. If you want the book so badly after throwing it away that you’re willing to buy another copy, then buy one – and this time read and study it.

The most difficult ones are those that give you moderate pleasure – those with words and phrases that moved your heart, and that you might want to read again. These are the hardest to discard. The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 109 | bei Position 991-995 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:39:03

The most difficult ones are those that give you moderate pleasure – those with words and phrases that moved your heart, and that you might want to read again. These are the hardest to discard. Although I felt no pressure to get rid of them, I could not overlook the fact that they only gave me moderate pleasure. I began to search for a way to let them go without regret and eventually hit upon what I called the ‘bulk reduction method’. Realising that what I really wanted to keep was not the book but certain information or specific words it contained, I decided that if I kept only what was necessary, I should be able to throw the rest away.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 109 | bei Position 991-996 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 08:39:08

The most difficult ones are those that give you moderate pleasure – those with words and phrases that moved your heart, and that you might want to read again. These are the hardest to discard. Although I felt no pressure to get rid of them, I could not overlook the fact that they only gave me moderate pleasure. I began to search for a way to let them go without regret and eventually hit upon what I called the ‘bulk reduction method’. Realising that what I really wanted to keep was not the book but certain information or specific words it contained, I decided that if I kept only what was necessary, I should be able to throw the rest away. My idea was to copy the sentences that inspired me into a notebook.

The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)

Sorting papers Rule of thumb: discard everything
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1020-1023 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:09:01

I confess. I hate filing papers! I never use multiple files or write labels. This system perhaps works better in an office setting, where many people use the same documents, but there is absolutely no need to use such a detailed filing system in the home. My basic principle for sorting papers is to throw them all away.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 112 | bei Position 1020-1025 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:09:19

I confess. I hate filing papers! I never use multiple files or write labels. This system perhaps works better in an office setting, where many people use the same documents, but there is absolutely no need to use such a detailed filing system in the home. My basic principle for sorting papers is to throw them all away. My clients are stunned when I say this, but there is nothing more annoying than papers. After all, they will never inspire joy, no matter how carefully you keep them. For this reason, I recommend you throw out anything that does not fall into one of three categories: currently in use, needed for a limited period of time, and must be kept indefinitely.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 113 | bei Position 1025-1028 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:09:38

The term ‘papers’, by the way, does not include papers with sentimental value like old love letters or diaries. Attempting to sort these will slow down your pace drastically. Limit yourself at first to sorting papers that give you no thrill at all and finish the job in one fell swoop. Letters from friends and lovers can be left for when you tackle sentimental items.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 113 | bei Position 1029-1030 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:10:54

My filing method is extremely simple. I divide them into two categories: papers to be saved and papers that need to be dealt with.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1032-1034 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:11:08

Make sure that you keep all such papers in one spot only. Never let them spread to other parts of the house. I recommend using a vertical organiser in which papers can be stored standing up and designating a specific place for it. All papers requiring attention can be placed in here without separating them.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1034-1035 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:11:18

As for papers that must be saved, these I subdivide according to the frequency of use. Again, the way I divide them is not complicated. I organise them into infrequently used papers and more frequently used papers.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1037-1038 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:11:49

As you will almost never need to access papers in this category, you don’t have to put a lot of effort into storing them. I recommend putting them all into a single ordinary clear plastic folder without worrying about further categorisation.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 114 | bei Position 1038-1042 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:12:17

The other subcategory consists of papers that you will take out and look at more frequently, such as outlines of seminars or newspaper clippings. These are meaningless unless they are stored in a way that’s easy to access and read, which is why I recommend inserting them into the book-like pages of a clear plastic file folder. This category is the trickiest of them all. Although papers like this are not really necessary, they tend to multiply. Reducing the volume of this category is key to organising your papers.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
- Deine Markierung auf Seite 115 | bei Position 1042-1045 | Hinzugefügt am Mittwoch, 12. April 2023 09:13:09

Papers are organised into only three categories: needs attention, should be saved (contractual documents), and should be saved (others). The point is to keep all papers in one category in the same container or folder and to purposely refrain from subdividing them any further by content. In other words, you only need three containers or folders. Don’t forget that the ‘needs attention’ box ought to be empty.
==========
The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying (Kondo, Marie)
